story:
Hello everyone! I am Nella Fragola, I've been an alternative model since 2007 and today I am very pleased to launch a project which is so dear to my heart! After a year of hard work alongside the photographers Alexandra Banti and Ultimate Psycho I finally present the creation of my portfolio "Femme Fétiche, Femme Fatale."

This portfolio will contain 12 A5 size photos, protected in a beautiful cover. These new photographs will illustrate the theme of womanhood and sensuality. 

*****

Bonjour tout le monde ! Je suis Nella Fragola, je suis modèle alternative depuis 2007 et aujourd'hui je suis ravie de lancer un tout nouveau projet très cher à mon coeur ! Après un an de travail aux côtés des photographes Alexandra Banti et Ultimate Psycho, je suis enchantée de vous présenter mon portfolio "Femme Fétiche, Femme Fatale" 

Il contiendra 12 photos A5, protégé dans une pochette. Ces photos illustrent ma définition de la sensualité féminine.  


I started as a model in 2007, lead by the fashion photographer Nicolas Meunier. Through this passion, I discovered a lot about myself. Modelling helped me to overcome my shyness and to assume my femininity. I always want to push myself and go beyond my own limit. Modelling is a rich and liberating form of expression.

J'ai commencé à poser en 2007, guidée par le photographe de mode Nicolas Meunier. A travers cette passion, je me suis découverte. Cela m'a aidé à surmonté ma timidité et assumer ma féminité. J'aime me surpasser et aller au delà de mes limites. C'est un moyen d'expression très riche et libérateur.


One year ago, I started a project with two photographers. We first wanted to make a calendar of my photos (a publisher asked us to do it, but it canceled when all our work was already done...). It was a real challenge for us: we had to shoot 12 unpublished photos in a very short time, and the biggest difficulty was innovating between each shot! We wanted to express many different sides of my personality and explore how I see eroticism and sensuality: Femme Fétiche, Femme Fatale.

Il y un an, nous avons commencé un projet de calendrier, commandé par un éditeur qui a malheureusement annulé alors que nous avions finit de réaliser toutes les photos. C'était un gros challenge pour nous: nous avions peu de temps, peu de moyens et nous devions innové entre chaque photo. On voulait montrer autant de facette de ma personnalité que possible;  et montrer ma vision de l'érotisme et de la sensualité: Femme Fétiche, Femme Fatale.


After several months of work, I have decided to do a more artistic project rather than a calendar. A calendar has a time limit: when the year is finished, what do you do with a calendar? Most of the time you throw it in the bin! How sad, right? I wanted a more durable object and still with an affordable price: the idea of the portfolio was born!

Après plusieurs mois de réflexion, j'ai décidé de proposer un objet plus artistique qu'un calendrier. En effet, ce dernier a une limite dans le temps. Que faites-vous d'un calendrier une fois l'année fini? Vous le jetez ! C'est triste, n'est-ce pas? J'avais envie de réaliser un objet durable dans le temps mais accessible niveau prix: l'idée du portfolio été née !

A photo from Alexandra Banti, Femme Fatale / Une photo d'Alexandra Banti, Femme Fatale


We are very proud of what we have accomplished. We hope you will enjoy the finished product as much as we do!
There is no art without the artist to create it. And being an artist is a hard job to do for a living. If this project is dear to my heart, it is for all the artists who followed me into it as well: photographers, graphic artists, makeup artists, hair stylists... Talented people who deserved to be paid (not only money, but with all your heart too)!

Your contribution will help us to cover all our costs:

  • Printing of the portfolio
  • Envelop 
  • Postal costs (worldwide)
  • Artists (2 photographer, 1 hair stylist, 1 make up artist, 1 co-model, 1 graphic designer and I as model)

Nous sommes très fiers de ce que nous avons accomplis. Nous espérons que vous aimerez le produit une fois finit autant que nous !

Il n'y a pas d'arts sans artiste pour le créer. Et être un artiste est un travail difficile à vivre. Si ce projet est cher à mon coeur, c'est pour tous les artistes qui ont cru en moi et m'ont suivi dans la réalisation du projet: photographes, graphiste, maquilleurs et coiffeurs... Artistes talentueux qui méritent d'être payés (pas seulement en argent mais aussi avec tout votre coeur) !

Votre contribution nous aidera à payer:
  • Les frais d'impression
  • Enveloppes
  • Les coûts postaux
  • Les artistes (2 photographes, 1 coiffeur, 1 maquilleur, 1 co-modèle, 1 graphiste et moi même)


A photo from the Fetish part, by Ultimate Psycho / Une photo de la partie fétiche, par les Ultimate Psycho

With those 2 000 € we could see our project in your hands! We won't be paid ourselves a lot. I especially wish to see the work of my team be paid as they deserved it. Artists should be able to live of what they create. Please, support the arts!
Avec ces 2 000 euros nous verrons notre projet finit dans vos mains ! Nous ne pourrons pas nous payer beaucoup. Mais même le minimum me rendra heureuse, je souhaite récompenser mon équipe au mieux ! Les artistes méritent rémunération ! Aidez les arts !

Sneak peek into the portfolio

All the photos will be printed by a professional (thank you Rémy Andre :>) on a high quality paper: Fujifilm Profesional Fujicolor. / Toutes les photos seront imprimées par un professionnel (merci Rémy André :>) sur un papier photo de haute qualité: Fujifilm Profesional Fujicolor.

Photos from Alexandra Banti, Femme Fatale. Six photos (5 never published before). / Photos d'Alexandra Banti, Femme Fatale. Six photos (5 inédites).

Photos from Ultimate Psycho Femme Fetiche. Six photos (5 never published before). / Photos des Ultimate Psycho Femme Fétiche. Six photos (5 inédites).

All the photos! / Toutes les photos !

The cardboard is designed by Messalyn and will be printed on the best paper I've found. / La pochette est designee par Messalyn and sera imprimée sur le meilleure papier que j'ai trouvé !


Nella Fragola's Classics

5 photographs from Nicolas Meunier, from 2010 to 2012. Oldies and classics!



Nella holding the photograph of Ultimate Psycho. This one is available in some packs!

5 from Nicolas Meunier, 1 from Ultimate Psycho. Thanks a lot for their donation of those photographs!


The team

Here are all the people who contributed to this project:
  • Cris Hairstyle
  • Leila Make Up Artist
  • Alexandra Banti (photographer)
  • Ultimate Psycho (photographer)
  • Camille de Kerorguen / Messalyn (graphic artist)
  • Nella Fragola

You won’t only buy photographs, but all the work of those great artists!


About "Four Horsemen"

We are serious people and we are professionals. For a while now, it occured to us that that it harder and harder to express ourselves trough our creations in the « normal » network. So, we decided to assemble under a shared label, Four Horsemen, us who have pictural and friendly strong links. Our themes cross eachothers, our way of working is punctilious and neat, our universes are rich and we wish to share with you who appreciate them. Yes that’s you.

We are :

  •  Lostfish
  •  Alexandra Banti
  • Camille de Kerorguen / Messalyn
  •  Nella Fragola
  •  Francois Amoretti

Our label, Four Horsemen, exists for few months now and under its maternal gaze should come to life our up-coming projects : comic books, artbooks, illustrated books, photographies, videos. For a start.
You can follow our respective news on our web sites and blogs.

story:
At Carson Research Consulting, we’re data nerds with a passion for maps, and we love Baltimore!

In general, Charm City doesn't have the greatest reputation. But no matter what you think about Baltimore, it definitely has one thing: heart. 

Baltimoreans love their city. So as locals, we tend to get a little touchy when we get surprised looks and timid questions from out-of-towners who ask, “You live in Baltimore? Is it really like The Wire?”  

Well, we're going to let the data do the talking because as researchers, we don't juke the stats!

To do this, we’re going to build a series of interactive maps using our online mapping tool, the Baltimore DataMind to map data for gun-related homicides and vacant housing for the neighborhoods where The Wire was filmed to get a more accurate picture of whether the perception of Baltimore created by the show matches the reality. 

It’s Data ReWired.


What we need

We need your help to get this project going!

We are trying to raise $10,000.

Funds will be used to support our Map Guy, who will gather and analyze data, and build an interactive map.

Improving Baltimore

If we’re able to fund this project, we’ll get the data we need to prove that Baltimore is better than its reputation from The Wire.

But more importantly, the goal of the Baltimore DataMind is to drive informed decision-making that will ultimately strengthen our city and make it even better.

Remember, every little bit helps us take steps to make Baltimore City great and make sure everyone else knows it too!

Please contribute to our campaign and help us promote access to community level data in our city! 

Perks!

Here are the amazing perks that you can get if you donate to the Data ReWired campaign:

  • $5- You'll be added to our email distribution list for the latest campaign and Baltimore DataMind updates
  • $25- We will email you a fun, digital image
  • $50- We will send you a Data ReWired or a We Don't Juke the Stats bumper sticker

  • $100- We will send you a "Ratfographic" Data Visualization poster

  • $250- We will send you a Data ReWired or a We Don't Juke the Stats t-shirt

  • $500- We will invite you to a Happy Hour event at the Carson Research office (you will be responsible for getting here)

  • $1000- You can add a point to the map, anywhere in Baltimore City

If you have an further questions, please email us at info@baltimoredatamind.org and our team will get back to you ASAP.

$250- We will send you a Data ReWired or a We Don't
Juke the Stats t-shirt










$500- We will invite you to a Happy Hour event at
the Carson Research office (you will be responsible for getting here)







$1000- You can add a point to the map, anywhere in
Baltimore City






If you have an further questions, please email us at info@baltimoredatamind.org and our team will get back to you ASAP.

story:
My name is Judith Prays and I am a Jewish artist. I am best known for creating
interactive experiments like the “Pheromone Parties”, matchmaking events based on smell that now take place globally, and have been featured on CNN, BBC, The Colbert Report and more.

The “10 commandments” project started 5 years ago, when I got fed up with being chronically indecisive. I began to research decision-making methods, and found that the key to effective decision making is a strong value system. I had never given much thought to value systems, and a slew of research brought me to the 10 commandments. As I explored them and took them on, my life was transformed. This was a pivotal paradigm shift.

The goal of this project is to share my experience of the 10 commandments and create a space for people to inspect their own value systems. This will manifest through a mutli-media event featuring the work of 20+ artists, geared towards creating interactions, introspection and dialogue about values.

The commandments are often referred to as light, so to best showcase them we searched for the darkest venue LA had to offer. We are thrilled to say a vacant 1930’s prison will be our host.


Guests will enter through the back entrance of the prison. Harp music will be audible as the guest climbs 1 flight of dark stairs illuminated by a light installation. Upon entering there will be multiple interactive elements, such as a spiritual interrogation room. The visitation room will feature work by 10 artists: 10 bracelets, each representing one of the 10 commandments. Each bracelet will be accompanied by a piece of writing by a different author, reflecting on the writers’ personal struggle with the commandment.


The venue is incredible and is already drawing a lot of interest. As a fan of the event said, if someone told them to come to a “10 commandments” party - they'd say, eh. But if someone told them to come to a party in a prison, they'd say, when and where?

But the costs are mounting. We need:

• the venues hourly fee

• an electric generator, as the venue has no electricity

• a water truck – the fire department requirement

• production insurance

• a production team

• a security team

• bathrooms – the venue has no running water

• a cleaning crew.

To make the event a success, we also want

• light installations

• projectors

• a photobooth and a roaming photographer

• printed signs

• a live harp choir


We'll work with what we get - but adequate funds mean a higher production value, and a more powerful and engaging experience.

story:
*** English below ***

Le but de notre campagne est d'amasser au moins 3000$ pour  lancer, en août prochain, le tout premier festival de l'agriCULTURE à NDG : Un festival de quartier qui mettra en valeur les richesses artistiques et agricoles de notre quartier.


Un festival de l'agriCULTURE dans nos jardins collectifs

Pour sa première édition, le festival offrira les activités suivantes:

  • Un échange de savoirs: un événement où les participants seront à la fois éducateurs et élèves. 
  • Une soirée de conte sous les étoiles: Au cœur de l'un de nos jardins collectifs des conteurs et des historiens nous raconterons le passé agricole de notre quartier.
  • Un spectacle de marionnettes où vous êtes le héros: Le Cheap Art Collective vous entraînera dans une aventure rocambolesque en compagnie de Mère Nature.
  • Une grande fête de quartier où la récolte est à l'honneur: L'équipe d'Action Communiterre organisera une grande tombola où les jeunes et moins jeunes du quartier pourront mettre à l'épreuve leur adresse et leurs connaissances en agriculture.


Comment seront utilisés les fonds amassés?

Les 3 000 $ couvriront les frais suivants:

  • Achat de matériel pour l'échange de savoir;
  • Compensation financière pour les conteurs et historiens;
  • Achat de matériel pour le spectacle de marionnettes géantes;
  • Location de tentes lors de la fête des récoltes;
  • Compensation financière pour les artistes et amuseurs publics lors de la fête des récoltes;
  • Autres frais liés à l'organisation du festival (promotion, assurances, etc.)

Sachez aussi que si nous dépassons notre objectif, les fonds supplémentaires serviront à bonifier nos programmes de jardinage collectif et de cuisine intergénérationnelle.


D'autres façons de nous appuyer

Vous aimez notre idée mais préférez nous appuyer autrement qu'avec une compensation financière. Voici comment vous pouvez le faire:

  • Faites connaitre notre campagne dans votre réseau. Un coup de fil, un partage sur Facebook, une mention sur Twitter, etc. Tous ces gestes nous aideront sans aucun doute;
  • Restez informé.e: Inscrivez-vous pour recevoir notre bulletin en visitant notre site internet, aimez notre page Facebook ou suivez-nous sur twitter.


En ordre alphabétique:

  • Café 92
  • Centre des sciences de Montréal
  • Coop de la Maison Verte
  • Écomusée du Fier-Monde
  • Espace pour la Vie
  • Ferme Lufa
  • Musée Grévin
  • Musée Pointe à Callières
  • Spa Ovarium
  • Sugar Sammy

Qui est Action Communiterre?

Nous sommes un organisme communautaire basé à Notre-Dame-de-Grâce qui vise la promotion de la sécurité alimentaire et de l'inclusion sociale. Pour y arriver, nous avons développé des programmes de jardinage collectif et de cuisine intergénérationnelle.

Bien qu'au centre de notre action, notre seul but n'est pas de produire des légumes frais ni de préparer des repas sains. Nous voyons aussi le jardinage et les ateliers de cuisine comme un moyen d'atteindre un autre objectif : Créer des communautés unies et résilientes. Ces activités deviennent donc des prétextes pour réunir les membres de la communauté, faire tomber les barrières sociales et tisser des amitiés durables.

Pour plus d'information, visitez: www.actioncommuniterre.qc.ca


*************************************************

An AgriCULTURE festival will take place in August 2014 in our collective gardens

The goal is to reach at least $3000 with the objective of hosting, this upcoming August, the first ever AgriCULTURE Festival in NDG. This neighbourhood festival will showcase the artistic and agricultural abundance of the neighbourhood.

For its first edition, the festival will offer the following activities:

  • A skills and knowledge exchange: an event where participants will be both educators and students.
  • An evening of storytelling under the stars: In the heart of one of our collective gardens, storytellers and historians will tell us the agricultural history of our neighbourhood.
  • A giant puppet show, where you are the hero: The Cheap Art Collective will take you on an incredible adventure in the company of Mother Nature.
  • A large community gathering where the harvest will be celebrated: Action Communiterre’s team will hold a big challenge where the young and old will test their skills and knowledge in agriculture.


How will the funds be spent?

The $3000 will cover the following expenses:

  • Purchase of equipment for the skills and knowledge exchange;
  • Financial compensation for storytellers, historians and artists;
  • Purchase of equipment for the giant puppets show;
  • Rental of tents during the harvest festival;
  • Financial compensation for artists and entertainers during the harvest festival;
  • Other costs related to the organization of the festival (promotion, insurance, etc.).

Also, please note that if we exceed our goal, additional funding will enhance our collective gardening program and intergenerational cooking activities.


Other Ways You Can Support Us

You like our idea, but you prefer to support other than with a financial contribution.

Here's how you can do:

Share our campaign in your network: A phone call, sharing on Facebook, a mention on Twitter, etc.. All these actions will help without a doubt;

Keep yourself informed: Sign up to receive our newsletter by visiting our website, like Facebook page or follow us on twitter.


In alphabetical order:

  • Café 92
  • Coop la Maison Verte
  • Écomusée du Fier-Monde
  • Espace pour la Vie
  • Grevin Museum
  • Lufa Farm
  • Montreal Science Centre
  • Ovarium Spa
  • Pointe à Callière Museum
  • Sugar Sammy


Who is Action Communiterre?

We are a community organization based in Notre-Dame-de-Grâce, which aims to promote food security and social inclusion. To achieve this, we have developed collective gardening and intergenerational cooking programs.

Even though it is the heart of our work, our aim is not only to produce vegetables or prepare healthy meals. We also see gardening and cooking workshops as a means to achieve another objective: to create united and resilient communities. These activities become pretexts to bringing together members of the community, breaking down social barriers and building lasting friendships.

For more information, visit: www.actioncommuniterre.qc.ca

story:
A Passion for the Power of the Arts...

In 2009 the core members of the Manifesto|Jamaica team started meeting...and meeting...and meeting. Meeting about what?...About what we were going to do to elevate Jamaica's Art & Culture, bringing it to the forefront as an agent of personal, community and national empowerment, and how we were going to do it. We decided to start with our peers - the youth of Jamaica - who are the one's who will have to BE the change.


Manifesto|Jamaica is an arts-focused, youth-led non-profit Movement based in Kingston, Jamaica. Our mission to EDUCATE, EXPOSE and EMPOWER youth through art and culture is furthered through community-based initiatives including arts workshops, seminars and healing activities, as well as staged productions where we expose the creativity that we unearth and develop. Our culminating activity is the annual Festival of ART'ical Empowerment, which is a 3-day celebration and showcase of our work throughout the year.


What's the difference?

Your contribution will bring the educational and healing power of art and creative expression to youth in Jamaica's "inner cities" and rural communities who have a wealth of talent, but have limited outlets to explore or express it. This same energy that has the potential to create has the potential to destroy, if not properly nurtured and chanelled. Be a part of Manifesto|Jamaica's mandate and mission to love, unify and uplift Jamaica's most precious natural resources; our people, our art and our culture.

So what do we need?

This year, we've finances all our community impact intiatives through fundraisers and investments of our personal resources. Our team is 100% volunteer-based, and we do not receive any goverment or private sector funding. This is where the need for people power comes in :)


Our 2nd annual Festival of ART'ical Empowerment is November 18-20, 2011 at the Edna Manley College of the Visual and Performing Arts (which is the only Art School in the entire Caribbean!). We need to raise at least $2,000 to feed our team members, volunteers and participating artists, and to transport the youth we work with from their  communities to the festival venue.


We're big on reciprocity, so when you donate


$10-$19 ...you get a hand-made Manifesto|JA pin


$20-$29 ...you get a hand-made Manifesto|JA keyring


$30 - $49 ... you get an autographed CD from an artiste of your choice who's on this year's show (TBA)


$50 or more ... you get a Special Edition Manifesto JA T-Shirt!


Sharing is Caring

Don't keep the good news to yourself! Share it with anyone and everyone.

Twitter...Facebook...Youtube...LinkedIn...Vimeo...post the info wherever you go :)


BE A PART OF IT!

story:
Mini-Festival d'art urbain à MTL

Production Karma Suta (Transporteur du Karma) est une entreprise qui oeuvre dans l'événementiel et qui a pour but de créer des événements qui offrent une expérience unique aux spectateurs. Nous voulons amasser un petit montant pour nous aider à créer un mini-festival (2 jours) qui mettra de l'avant les artistes visuels et les musiciens de Montréal durant l'automne 2014.

Le montant demandé ne représente pas la totalité du coût d'un tel festival mais seulement une somme qui nous permettra d'aller de l'avant afin de démarrer le projet (location des salles et coûts des démarches préparatoires).

Même si le montant total n'est pas atteint, les sommes amassées seront utilisées pour créer un événement qui donnera de la visibilité à nos artistes locaux.

Monter un festival peut être très difficile lors des premières éditions. Il faut faire face à des démarches administratives ardues et avoir les reins solides pour y arriver. Nous croyons qu'en combinant votre aide et notre détermination, nous pourrons y arriver!!

story:
Hello there!

Thank you for finding your way to my crowdfunding campaign. As you may have guessed, I am hoping to gather some money for something that is very important to me. But I will get to that later, let me start by introducing myself:

My name is Meike Zane. I’m a 24 year old portrait artist from the Netherlands, with a dream to turn my hobby into a career. Drawing, especially portraits, is my passion and something I would do 24/7 if I had the chance. This dream all started on December 31st, 2009. My dad passed away unexpectedly and his last words, the evening before, were to me; that he was so proud of me and my drawings. Looking back, my drawings really weren’t even that good back then. But – his words stuck with me and I decided I wanted to honor them by continuing to draw to the best of my ability. Over the years that followed both that ability as well as my desire to succeed became considerably larger. Now, we are here.

In order to be able to continue growing in my art and become a professional artist there are a few things I need. First of all, I need to move to London (UK). This small town in the south of the Netherlands? It’s not gonna happen out here. But don’t worry, I’ve got the London part under control. What I don’t have is the right material to become better at my art and provide customers with the best drawings I could possibly make. In short: I need better equipment.

I want to be able to make works that are 100% mine, from start to finish. This means I want to work with reference photographs that I took myself (whenever possible), but unfortunately – my camera is old, and while I love it to pieces (... it's almost *in* pieces as well), it is just not good enough. I need a new camera, and a few accessories – such as a lens, external flash, camera bag, and memory cards – to go with it, to be able to make completely original works. This is the main part that you, as a potential contributor, would help me with. Any extra money acquired would go to other necessary items, such as better pencils, paper, a good scanner (also very pricey), and more.

What I Need

After some thorough research, both on the Internet to see what’s available, and in my brain to see what I really need, I have compiled a short list of items and their average prices that I really need to be able to start. Here they are:

Camera body: Canon EOS 7D – approximately 1000 euros
Camera lens: Canon EF 85mm f/1.8 USM – approximately 350 euros
External flash: Speedlite 430EX II – approximately 250 euros
Additional accessories (camera bag, memory cards) – approximately 100 euros

This comes to a total of 1700 euros. I set the target to 2000 euros, because with many of the perks shipping costs are included and I need to be able to pay for those. Any extra money received could go to a better body/lens, or other equipment I will need such as a good scanner (A3 preferably), paper, pencils, brushes, watercolours, ink, blending stumps, erasers, portfolios, and so on and so forth. Maybe even help towards renting a slightly larger room in London so I actually have enough space to be able to create my artwork in the comfort of my own room. But as stated – that is all secondary to getting the right equipment.

What You Get

Perks! Let’s be honest, this is the most important part, isn’t it? What do you get for supporting me? Well.. I don’t think this is a tough one to guess. Artwork! I am an artist after all, what better to offer than artwork?

I have a few perks available, ranging from 1 euro (a simple massive thank you for contributing!) to 450 euros (the mega pack!). Included in these perks are original drawings and sketches, Trees of Life, EXCLUSIVE prints, and postcards prints (in case you love Benedict Cumberbatch.. and why wouldn’t you?).

The original, custom drawings are offered on size A5 (5.8”x 8.3” / 148 x 210mm) and size A4 (8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm). The drawings are done with graphite pencils, and are detailed realism:

The sketches are on size A5, and are realism. They might not be detailed, but do capture the essence of the subject. But please, do decide for yourself:


Trees of Life are lovely necklaces and decorations I’ve been making for about a year or two now. You can see them as something spiritual, because of the idea behind the Tree of Life (a tree that connects all life in this world) or because of the gemstones. You can also just see them as pretty items:

You can find more examples in the image gallery.

The 'The Batch' perk consists of these postcards:

The exclusive prints are of the following drawings:

Mark Gatiss:

Ben Whishaw:

Lee Pace as Thranduil:

Louise 'Loo' Brealey:


What if I don’t reach the target?

If I don’t reach the target, I will still get the money – that’s how flexible funding works. In that case I will set the money aside until I have earned enough (it might take a while) to buy the camera and other necessary equipment. Trust me – your money will only go towards my advancement in my career as a portrait artist, regardless of whether I reach the needed funds now or in a few months/years.

Risks & Challenges

Are there any risks & challenges? Of course there are. There always are. What if I break my arm and can’t create the perks for a few weeks? In that case it would take a lot longer to get all perks done & shipped out.  I promise I’ll try to not break anything though.

Do keep in mind that creating custom drawings takes time. I will not be able to ship your drawing within a week of the campaign closing (unless you’re among the first ones I start with. Lucky you!). If you need the drawing before Christmas or any other deadline, please ask me before contributing and picking that perk. If you don't ask me beforehand if I can make a deadline, I can’t make any promises to have it finished and shipped (shipping might take a while if you don’t live in the same country) before a certain day.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute (aww!), but you do wish to help me (yay!), you can try and get the word out about this campaign. Share it with your friends, your family, your classmates, your colleagues, or your networks on social media. Even if only one of them then contributes 1 euro, you will have made a difference, for which I thank you.

If at all possible, use the IndieGogo share tools – and make sure you are logged in to your IndieGogo account when doing so. I can track referrals that way.. and.. the person whose friends’ contributions amount to the highest amount of money will win TWO sketches!  Remember – log in to IndieGogo and use the share tools, otherwise the referrals will not be tracked and can’t be counted towards your total!
story_txt:
Hello there! Thank you for
finding your way to my crowdfunding campaign. As you may have guessed, I am
hoping to gather some money for something that is very important to me. But I
will get to that later, let me start by introducing myself:

My name is
Meike Zane. I’m a 24 year old portrait artist from the Netherlands, with a
dream to turn my hobby into a career. Drawing, especially portraits,
is my passion and something I would do 24/7 if I had the chance. This dream all
started on December 31st, 2009. My dad passed away unexpectedly and
his last words, the evening before, were to me; that he was so proud of me and
my drawings. Looking back, my drawings really weren’t even
that good back then. But – his words stuck with me
and I decided I wanted to honor them by continuing to draw to the best of my
ability. Over the years that followed both that ability as well as my desire to
succeed became considerably larger. Now, we are here.
In order to be
able to continue growing in my art and become a professional artist there are a
few things I need. First of all, I need to move to London (UK). This small town
in the south of the Netherlands? It’s not gonna happen out here. But don’t
worry, I’ve got the London part under control. What I don’t have is the right
material to become better at my art and provide customers with the best
drawings I could possibly make. In short: I need better equipment.
I want to be
able to make works that are 100% mine, from start to finish. This means I want
to work with reference photographs that I took myself (whenever possible), but
unfortunately – my camera is old, and while I love it to pieces (... it's almost *in* pieces as well), it is just not good enough. I need a new camera, and
a few accessories – such as a lens, external flash, camera bag, and memory
cards – to go with it, to be able to make completely original works. This is
the main part that you, as a potential contributor, would help me with. Any
extra money acquired would go to other necessary items, such as better pencils,
paper, a good scanner (also very pricey), and more.
What I Need
After some
thorough research, both on the Internet to see what’s available, and in my
brain to see what I really need, I have compiled a short list of items and
their average prices that I really need to be able to start. Here they are:
Camera body:
Canon EOS 7D – approximately 1000 euros
Camera lens: Canon EF 85mm f/1.8 USM – approximately 350 euros
External flash: Speedlite 430EX II – approximately 250 euros
Additional accessories (camera bag, memory cards) – approximately 100 euros
This comes to a
total of 1700 euros. I set the target to 2000 euros, because with many of the perks shipping costs are included and I need to be able to pay for those. Any extra money received
could go to a better body/lens, or other equipment I will need such as a good scanner
(A3 preferably), paper, pencils, brushes, watercolours, ink, blending stumps,
erasers, portfolios, and so on and so forth. Maybe even help towards renting a
slightly larger room in London so I actually have enough space to be able to
create my artwork in the comfort of my own room. But as stated – that is all
secondary to getting the right equipment.
What You Get
Perks! Let’s be
honest, this is the most important part, isn’t it? What do you get for
supporting me? Well.. I don’t think this is a tough one to guess. Artwork! I am
an artist after all, what better to offer than artwork?
I have a few
perks available, ranging from 1 euro (a simple massive thank you for
contributing!) to 450 euros (the mega pack!). Included in these perks are
original drawings and sketches, Trees of Life, EXCLUSIVE prints, and postcards
prints (in case you love Benedict Cumberbatch.. and why wouldn’t you?).
The original,
custom drawings are offered on size A5 (5.8”x 8.3” / 148 x 210mm) and size A4
(8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm). The drawings are done with graphite pencils, and
are detailed realism:
The sketches
are on size A5, and are realism. They might not be detailed, but do capture the
essence of the subject. But please, do decide for yourself:Trees of Life
are lovely necklaces and decorations I’ve been making for about a year or two
now. You can see them as something spiritual, because of the idea behind the
Tree of Life (a tree that connects all life in this world) or because of the
gemstones. You can also just see them as pretty items:You can find
more examples in the image gallery.The 'The Batch' perk consists of these postcards:The exclusive prints are of the following drawings:Mark Gatiss:Ben Whishaw:Lee Pace as Thranduil:Louise 'Loo' Brealey:What if I don’t reach the target?
If I don’t
reach the target, I will still get the money – that’s how flexible funding works.
In that case I will set the money aside until I have earned enough (it might
take a while) to buy the camera and other necessary equipment. Trust me – your money
will only go towards my advancement in my career as a portrait artist, regardless
of whether I reach the needed funds now or in a few months/years.
Risks & Challenges
Are there any
risks & challenges? Of course there are. There always are. What if I break
my arm and can’t create the perks for a few weeks? In that case it would take a lot longer to get all perks done & shipped out.  I
promise I’ll try to not break anything though.
Do keep in mind
that creating custom drawings takes time. I will not be able to ship your
drawing within a week of the campaign closing (unless you’re among the first
ones I start with. Lucky you!). If you need the drawing before Christmas or any
other deadline, please ask me before contributing and picking that perk. If you don't ask me beforehand if I can make a deadline, I can’t make any promises to
have it finished and shipped (shipping might take a while if you don’t live in
the same country) before a certain day.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t
contribute (aww!), but you do wish to
help me (yay!), you can try and get the word out about this campaign. Share it
with your friends, your family, your classmates, your colleagues, or your
networks on social media. Even if only one of them then contributes 1 euro, you
will have made a difference, for which I thank you.
If at all
possible, use the IndieGogo share tools – and make sure you are logged in to
your IndieGogo account when doing so. I can track referrals that way.. and.. the
person whose friends’ contributions amount to the highest amount of money will
win TWO sketches!  Remember – log in to IndieGogo and use the share
tools, otherwise the referrals will not be tracked and can’t be counted towards
your total!

story:
This campaign is designed to: 

Help launch a new mug, a saucy little addition to your morning coffee routine. I've been making this F-bomb Mug for friends and family only, but now I want to offer it to everyone, because everyone deserves to start their day with a "Fuck Yeah!" salute in 22k Gold. 


About Paper & Clay

Paper & Clay is a modern ceramics line created by Brit McDaniel in 2013. 

As the designer behind Paper & Clay, I make modern functional ceramics that are designed to be both beautiful and very usable. I draw inspiration from my love of Scandinavian design — in the design of my forms and development of glazes, but also in a broader sense. I love having simple but well made elements as a part of my own home, and I strive to create work that fits that form.  

Each piece is made by hand with careful attention to detail, and each glaze has been carefully developed from scratch to create subtle and unique colors that mix and match harmoniously. I source many materials locally and all within the U.S. I’m committed to growing Paper & Clay slowly and sustainably in order to build a lasting brand that is committed to quality handmade ceramic wares.




What We Need & What You Get

The nitty gritty of what I need:

  • $500 to order custom gold decals for the mugs. I've been painting them by hand with the help of a stencil, but with the higher demand I want to move to the faster and higher quality method of Gold decals. 
  • $850 for a small test kiln. This has been on my studio NEED LIST for a while, but these mugs make it absolutely necessary. This will allow me to test glazes and decals without wasting energy, and will also allow me to make the F-bomb mugs in small batches after the campaign. 
  • You'll get a 12oz handmade mug (in your choice of color) with "Fuck Yeah" written in 22k Gold! You'll also get the mug at a discount! The retail price is $64, but here you'll be able to purchase for as little as $50 plus free shipping (US only)! You could save up to $26 on each mug! 
  • You Get a handmade Dessert Plate (or set)! Normally $36 each, get a F-bomb plate for $30 or for as little as $25 each when you order a set of 4! 
  • NEW NOTE! It wasn't clear before, (and now I can't edit the perks to say this!), but I'll contact you after the campaign ends so that you can make a color selection. Black or White for the classic mugs or the various color choices listed in the other rewards. YOU get to choose! Yay! xoxo

The Impact

I designed this mug for those of us who like to take our day by the horns. There's a lot to accomplish, and sometimes we find many obstacles in our way. This mug is a fun way to remind yourself over your yummy cup of joe that hey, I GOT THIS. Fuck Yeah!

Risks & Challenges

Ceramic work is volatile and sometimes things happen during the process that are out of the artists's control. This means that the risk of delay in production is possible, though I've worked a bit of a cushion into my Indiegogo timelines. Rest assured that:

  • I will do my best to get all orders out by the promised date
  • I will be sure to clearly communicate any delays 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but you still want to help:

  • Share the campaign on Social Media or privately with friends or family who you think might love this mug!
  • Follow my studio on Instagram: @britmcdaniel or on Twitter: @brit_mcdaniel

THANK YOU so much for your suppoert!

story:
Campaign Goal:

I will be collaborating with classical musicians this fall to create a video installation and an interactive performance art. 
I need your help and support to cover some of my expenses towards art supplies, fabric, equipment rentals and shipping fees to Germany and Canada.

Germany Project: Video Installation

Residency Date: October 19 - 28th, 2015.

Performance Date:

October 23rd  at Landesmusikakademie NRW, Heek, Germany

October 25th at Romaneum Concert Hall, Neuss Germany

I will be collaborating with Sebastian Lambertz to curate a new concert series at RomaNeum, a music school in Neuss, Germany. We will be performing/exhibiting Olivier Messiaen's Quartet for the End of Time.

The ensemble will consist of Sebastian Lambertz (clarinet), Almuth Siegel (violin), Samuel Pierce-Ruhland (cello), and Nenad Lucic (piano)



Help make it happen! 

Thank you for your time and consideration to read my campaign!

story:
Hranislav Mirkovic, photographer and pre-press expert.

The last 12 years I‘ve dedicated all my spare time, skills, knowledge and financial recourses to a special mission: to publish a unique high-quality photo monograph of ICONS from Orthodox Monastery Hilandar, dating from The Holy Evangelist Luke himself to 17th century and thus to reveal this, practically unknown, treasure to the world.

 

ABOUT THE PROJECT:

I had an honor to get, not only a permit to visit Hilandar several times, but also took thousands of high quality photos, including 114 extraordinary icons for this publication. Among these relics are the Wonderworking Icons of the Theotokos "Of the Akathist" and "Of the Three Hands" that is believed to be painted by The Holy Evangelist Luke himself. The book contains 330 pages with detailed information on every icon. Same material will be presented in the photo exhibition of the highest quality.

Monastery Hilandar is located on the miraculous Mount Athos, a mountain and peninsula in Greece, a home to 20 eastern Orthodox monasteries. Mount Athos is commonly referred to as the “Holy Mountain“.

Steep, densely forested slopes up to 2,033 meters high and dangerous surrounding seas, make the only access by boat very challenging.

The restricted number of visitors is required to obtain a special entrance permit. Females are not allowed to enter the peninsula for centuries and only way for them to see treasures and architecture of the monasteries is trough printed publications, photo exhibitions or videos. Monastery Hilandar have one of the greatest collections of Icons in the world.

In the Gallery you can see all of the ICONS from this project.

 

NEED:

Till now I‘ve succeeded to accomplish all the main phases of the Project: photographing the icons, preparing all the photos for high-quality printing, getting experts to write comprehensive accompanying text in Serbian. Translation to English language is in progress.

Everything is almost ready for printing and publishing. But the cost highly exceeds my financial potentials.

The cost of translation to English, printing the Book and making Photo Exhibition will reach $84,000.00.

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

You can make a financial donation. With a small donation you can support studying and promoting Christian cultural heritage and its moral values.

You can help spread the word. If this isn‘t the right time for you to give money, you can still support the Project by telling your friends about this campaign. Just e-mailing link of this page to 10 friends, reposting on your Facebook page, or Tweeting about it could make a significant difference.

story:
Crow Sourcing by Andy Deck

Do you have the "memory of an elephant"? Are you "wise as an owl" or are you a "bird brain"? How does the "crow fly"? As "crooked as a dog's hind leg"? Crow_Sourcing engages collective memory and insight to demystify and reanimate a dizzying array of sayings, idioms, and expressions like these. It's not "snake oil" – no, it's the "cat's pajamas." Or as they say in Australia, "the duck's guts." Hundreds of these idioms have been discussed and collected via Web, mobile, and social media for the past year. Now it's time to edit and publish the findings in a more durable format.

The purpose of this fundraising effort is to finance two print publications: a calendar and a book. Each will include original research and illustrations that complement the many, many expressions that connect us through language to the natural world.

Look what the cat dragged in

When I began this project I figured it would be interesting. But really I had no idea how much fun it would be to learn about animal expressions. It's more fun than a barrel of monkeys. With the help of many volunteers contributors, I have learned about the wide variety of expressions that are used around the world. In some cases these idioms reflect pre-industrial human civilization. Ideas survive in language that have become, for most people, dead metaphors. In short, there are many ways in which these habits of speech are thought provoking. In our collective memory there are fascinating lessons about our understanding of nature.

Straight from the horse's mouth

Over the past century the populations of many species that are fixtures of storytelling, like tigers and whales, have been pushed to the brink of extinction by the environmental impact of humans. In general the tide of extinction is rising. This has led me to think about ways that, through art, I can cause people to reflect on their environmental impact. And on the amazing diversity of nature that should be passed on to future generations.

Ants at a picnic

Now, it's obvious that preachy and depressing art is unpopular. So I am employing mental jujitsu to get people to engage with the topic indirectly. In everyday speech there are hundreds of expressions that evoke animal nature. Some of the expressions are accurate and insightful, while others are quite random and misleading. This leads to some interesting philosophical issues about how we know wild creatures. Is it through direct experience? Language? Television?

Cash cow?

The funding target – $1000 – is the bare minimum to accomplish the two publications. The full amount will be consumed by printing costs. Realistically it would be better to have at least $3000, but this funding game dictates that the target be set low to avoid forfeiting 5% of the funds. In any case, the book and calendar will be made. I have learned to make stone soup, or, to put it another way, to "make a silk purse from a sow's ear."

Nervous as a cat?

I've been making calendars for over thirty years (a "coon's age"?). The fact that I haven't missed a year since the 1980s should give you confidence that the calendar is happening! Yours will be printed in color, with high quality paper. The book draws upon the same skills and research. The book printing will be outsourced. Although I have never made a book with more than 40 pages, I have already produced several small publications with the same company, so I am aware of the process and costs involved. Moreover, I'm excited to see the results in print.

Ants in my pants

To be honest, this kind of fundraising makes me a little uncomfortable. That is why it's important to me to offer quality premiums. If you have loads of cash, by all means make a donation. But in general, I'm happy to provide you with unique printed matter.

Free as a bird

So you don't have any extra "clams"? Don't worry. If you know a hawk from a handsaw, or have the sense that God gave geese, make a bee-line for the website and separate the sheep from the goats until you’re dog tired. Eager beaver, take the bull by the horns. Talk turkey and get on your high horse. Clear up the hogwash contributed by the birdbrains. Monkey around and make them eat crow. Before long, book worms everywhere will be reading your contributions.

About the Artist

Andy Deck specializes in electronic media art, mostly of the interactive variety. As a pioneer of new media art, Deck has demonstrated the potential for open works and collaboration online. For years his net art has explored participative and creative processes made possible by the Internet. His work challenges the traditional role of artist as the content provider, and at the same time it reveals how interactive systems constrain creativity. Deck’s work also links online media with problematics of environmental sustainability by bridging art and eco-activism. He is a co-founder of Transnational Temps, a collective concerned with making Earth Art for the 21st Century.TM

Deck was awarded a first prize in the 2011 LÚMEN_EX Digital Art Awards. His work has been honored in numerous other contexts including Prix Ars Electronica, the Webby Awards, the Biennial of Ibiza, and the Web Biennial of Istanbul. His work has been shown at the Zentrum für Kunst und Medientechnologie (Karlsruhe), the Museu d'Art Contemporani de Barcelona, PS1-MoMA (New York), the Museum of Comic and Cartoon Art (New York), and the Machida City Museum (Tokyo), amongst others. His work, which is featured by the Whitney Artport and the Tate Online, has been commissioned by these and other prestigious institutions.

Thanks
 
Crow_Sourcing is a 2012 commission of New Radio and Performing Arts, Inc. for its Turbulence website. It was made possible with funds from the Jerome Foundation. The plan to use crowdsourcing to fund a book and a calendar was integral to the original proposal.

He is a co-founder of Transnational Temps, a collective concerned with making Earth Art for the 21st Century.TM
Deck was awarded a first prize in the 2011 LÚMEN_EX Digital Art Awards. His work has been honored in numerous other contexts including Prix Ars Electronica, the Webby Awards, the Biennial of Ibiza, and the Web Biennial of Istanbul. His work has been shown at the Zentrum für Kunst und Medientechnologie (Karlsruhe), the Museu d'Art Contemporani de Barcelona, PS1-MoMA (New York), the Museum of Comic and Cartoon Art (New York), and the Machida City Museum (Tokyo), amongst others. His work, which is featured by the Whitney Artport and the Tate Online, has been commissioned by these and other prestigious institutions.
Thanks

 
Crow_Sourcing is a 2012 commission of New Radio and Performing Arts, Inc. for its Turbulence website. It was made possible with funds from the Jerome Foundation. The plan to use crowdsourcing to fund a book and a calendar was integral to the original proposal.

story:
(Versión en español debajo) 

"Touch" is a public art project consisting of an image of two hands performing a gesture of intimate connection, printed on a bus wrap that will circulate for a month in the city of Richmond, Virginia. The importance of this image relies on the persistence of its gesture, counter to the increasingly individualist and threatening times we live in based on a fear and rejection towards “the other”.

Each bus is assigned a different route every day. This enables the image to be disseminated as widely as possible. The bus will run from more lower class neighborhoods such as Blackwell and Broad Rock in the South Side to more upper class areas like The Fan and The Museum District among others.

I aim to communicate directly with a general public by appropriating and altering strategies of a commercial discourse to re-constitute that which belongs to Richmond’s citizens, the streets. I have specially chosen a simple and direct image of human contact reaching for a diverse, heterogeneous and unsuspecting audience. The use of cropping of the image allows for the audience to project themselves in the space of the image; whether it is the hand being touched or the touching hand. I want this transient piece to have passersby experience the unexpected: an image of a human touch. It is an invitation to slow down for a moment and contemplate, about what an image of an affectionate touch means to those passing through.

Link to my website http://www.mariatinaut.com/

 "Touch" es un proyecto de arte público consistente una imagen de dos manos, una posada sobre la otra en un gesto de conexión íntima. Esta imagen circulará impresa en un autobús durante un mes por la ciudad de Richmond, Virginia. La importancia de esta imagen recae en la cualidad de resistencia intrínseca en el gesto, contrario a unos tiempos como los de ahora, cada vez más individualistas y amenazantes basados en el miedo y rechazo hacia "lo otro". 

La linea de ruta asignada a cada autobús cambia cada día. Esto permite que la imagen se disemine lo máximo posible. El autobús circulará por  las barriadas más marginales como Blackwell y Broad Rock en el sur de la ciudad a zonas más residenciales de clase media-alta como The Fan o The Museum District entre otros. 

Pretendo comunicarme directamente con un público general, ajeno a a los circuitos habituales del arte, apropiándome y alterando estrategias de un discurso comercial para re-conquistar aquello que pertenece a los ciudadanos de Richmond, las calles. He elegido concretamente una imagen tan sencilla y directa de contacto humano aspirando a conectar con una audiencia diversa y heterogénea. La forma en que la imagen está recortada y descontextualizada, permite a los viandantes, ciclistas, y conductores, proyectar su propia interpretación sobre ella. Así, uno puede elegir ser la mano tocada o la mano que se posa sobre la primera, en un acto de consuelo. Quiero que esta pieza temporal permita a los transeúntes experimentar lo inesperado: una imagen de contacto humano. Esta pieza de arte público es una invitación para detenerse por un momento y reflexionar sobre qué significa para cada uno encontrarse de manera fortuita con un imagen de un gesto de afecto entre dos personas. 

Link a mi página web http://www.mariatinaut.com/

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
I have loved paper since I was a small child.  I had a wall with my favorite gift wrap taped to it!  It has been a constant in my life, but I didn't know until 2009 that it was to become my passion and purpose.

In June 2009, I decided to start a stationery company, S2 Stationery and Design. I wanted my business to focus on eco-friendly paper and printing techniques. As I designed more and began working with different papers, I realized I not know how the paper I was using was being made. The sources could have been hurting the planet! At the same time, I began to work more and more with hand made papers from around the world, and a light bulb went off - I knew that to truly learn the art and the craftsmanship of real paper making, I would have to go to the source- to the artists directly making paper by hand to learn their traditions and techniques.

I want to learn everything about paper making around the world: from the moment bark, fiber, and other materials are collected to create the pulp that will eventually become sheets of paper, to the flattening and drying processes, to the final way designs for each sheet is determined, and everything in between.

My trip will begin on October 15th when I take the train from Tokyo to Echizen, Japan, on the western side of the country. Echizen has a history rich in making Japanese Washi paper. It has a museum, Echizen Washi Paper and Culture Museum where those interested in paper can stay and study for a few weeks.  I have been in touch with the museum and will be spending around 2, no more than 3, months at the museum working with the artists to learn washi paper making and will teach a few classes at the end of December. I am so excited for this opportunity!

If I can raise the money through this campaign, I will travel from Japan to countries in South East Asia (Thailand, Cambodia, Philippines, Vietnam and Indonesia) learning their paper traditions. Most programs run a week or two in these countries and require travel to each country as well as lodging expenses. Money raised will go directly to travel to each paper making program, lodging, fees and supply costs for each program. Additional money raised than the asking amount will go to helping me stay longer in each country.

All of the reward incentives offered will be done on paper I make during the time spent learning in these various countries. They will all be marked accordingly so you know where that particular art came from.

I will be documenting the experience as often as I can via my company blog. I will also be sending out email updates regularly to those who would like to receive them.

Thank you for helping me get to this point. If you can't donate, please spread the word. Paper and writing lovers let's do this!

story:
#ARTSNEXTCHAPTER

As a child, I thought art and philanthropy were reserved for the wealthy. But, like many, I always had a yearning to give and even buy art one day. My Dad told my sister and me that you don’t have to be rich to be kind, philanthropic, or even indulge in the arts. He told us to be creative, think large, and come up with an idea to meet these aspirations. 

Our entire education teaches us to strive for the top of the class, to get a great job, and make money. Rarely are we taught to be imaginative, passionate, and kind. I come from a background in banking and financial reporting, but I was not inspired by only maximizing profits. I wanted to imagine a new business model – one that aggregates shared resources and provides shared benefits. There are enough resources on this planet, we just have to be creative about how to use them.

I asked myself: what if we could unlock the value of art – a transformative, virtuous, universal medium – as a vehicle for social good? And do it in such a way that ensures your contribution is making a difference? More importantly, how could someone like you or me experience the joy of knowing that we can make a difference, too?

With these goals in mind, Art of Kindness was created to unite a family love of art with my strong business acumen and passion for social impact.

I have spent the past two years researching and developing the ideas behind Art of Kindness by working with partners, artists, collectors and industry experts to validate our mission. I even focused my graduate thesis at Imperial College Business School on Art of Kindness. In December of last year, Imperial College sponsored me for a UK entrepreneurial visa, providing further affirmation for the business.

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT- OUR FIRST EXHIBITION

The Art of Kindness exhibition will showcase our mission through a new and exciting digital art experience. The unique interactive exhibition will broadcast art, its patronage, and the potential for social good. This transformative experience will be centred on showcasing digital mediums to portray the connection between the human phenomena of kindness and art as a new language for human possibility.

London based architecture firm Tonkin Liu is custom designing a unique installation to help us take viewers on this new journey, designing it for future use and integrating the philosophy behind our organization into the concept.

This pop-up exhibition is the first step towards our long-term goal of integrating technology into the Art of Kindness platform, which allows us to portray this new narrative in a more impactful, tangible, and unique way.

Here the art will be for sale, which allows us to give a percentage directly to our social impact partner organizations. We will also display the pieces of art that have already been sold and start to reveal the impact these funds have had on the social project being supported.

This is the intention behind our business and the focus of our first exhibition. We want to showcase the future possibilities of the next chapter of art’s story, while also celebrating the previous ones, creating a new art journey and kindness experience.

The exhibition will explore three areas:

  • Primarily, we will explore what attracts us to art and how we can capture those sentiments in a unique digital experience.
  • Second, we will define what kindness means to us. How does it manifest in art? In nature? In our communities? In our consciousness?
  • Finally, we will test our goal of celebrating the human phenomena of kindness and imprinting this into our consciousness through digital and smart technologies.

 

WHAT EXACTLY WE NEED FROM YOU

Corporations or institutions traditionally sponsor art exhibitions. Since Art of Kindness is building a community, we want to give art lovers and philanthropists the opportunity to join us and participate in this experience.

We’re asking you to help us raise £45,000 (the equivalent of $57,000) for the five day, pop-up exhibition.

 

HOW WE WILL USE THE FUNDS

£45,000 will fund the hard costs of the exhibition needed to get this off the ground. This includes: covering the costs associated with renting the exhibition space, setting up the digital build out to support our unique experience, and producing the custom designed installation from the talented team at London Tonkin Liu. This also includes bringing some of the artists to London for the exhibition.

Your contribution will go directly to the exhibition and our digital build out which further amplifies the experience with our partners, artists, collectors and the crowd.

 

WHAT IS ART OF KINDNESS?

Art of Kindness celebrates the most vital aspect of the human spirit: kindness.

Our platform enables you to:

1. SELECT AND PURCHASE YOUR ARTWORK

         

Our artists have exhibited all over the world, are renowned in their field, and personally advocate for social causes. They produce work across multiple mediums including painting, sculpture, photography and mixed media. They hail from all over the world: from New Zealand and India to the UK, Portugal and the US. Meet some of our artists:

Petroc Sesti

Petroc Sesti is a London-based artist born in 1973, whose work is exhibited in museums and permanent collections around the world. He works in a variety of mediums exploring concepts of physics, cosmology and matter.

Rita GT

Rita GT lives between Luanda, Angola and Viana do Castelo, Portugal. She is the founder of e-Studio Luanda – an active collaboration platform between Rita GT and other artists with a focus on art as critical thinking regarding Contemporary Art of Africa and the diaspora.

Virginia Leonard

The highly individual and evocative ceramics of the Auckland based artist are honest self-portraits that address her bodily scarring and experiences of chronic pain, injuries obtained in a serious motorbike accident in London in 1986.

Natvar Bhavsar

Born in Gujarat, India in 1934, Bhavsar moved to the US in the early 1960’s, where he became an influential member of the New York School of Colorists. He is credited with easternizing the Color Field language through his use of thrown and sifted pigment.

Nathan Slate Joseph

An integral member of the New York School of Art for more than forty years, he blurs the boundary between painting and sculpture. Alluding to issues of globalization, immigration and climate change, he collects shards of discarded steel and stains them with raw pigment and acid.

Seema Kohli

Celebrated Indian artist and visual storyteller whose work spans over three decades. Her paintings, drawings, and public murals are an extension of her creative growth and search for self.

Revati Sharma Singh

International contemporary artist who uses her art to showcase the issues that face Indian society. She currently uses her art for good, supporting charities based in Indian cities.

Klaus Thymann

Danish born multi-award winning photographer, filmmaker and creative director. He has developed an original viewpoint having worked across a wide range of subjects and media.

Doug Patterson

London based artist trained at the Royal College of Art. Combining art and architecture, he retraces the journeys of travelling artists and others through watercolour.

Brinda Miller

Studied Textile Design at Sir J.J. School of Art and Drawing and Painting at the Parsons School of Design, New York. Since 1982, Brinda has had 15 solo exhibitions and has been responsible for bringing public art to the city of Mumbai.

2. PICK A CAUSE YOU LOVE AND SEE THE IMPACT CREATED

www.acumen.org

www.elephant-family.org

www.charitywater.org

www.project-pressure.org

www.micrograam.com

Each of our partners has a proven ability to deliver on their promise of building a better world in a very transparent and engaging way. Like Art of Kindness, storytelling is built into their mission.

3. CELEBRATE AND SHARE WITH OTHERS (in the future on the AoK app)

 

4. BUILD YOUR LEGACY OF KINDNESS (in the future on www.artofkindness.co.uk platform)

Art of Kindness is a new and exciting marketplace for art, where artists and collectors can discover, exhibit, buy, and sell art while giving to a cause they love. A portion of the proceeds from each sale is given to one of our social impact partners from all over the world. We share the same proceeds from the sale of the artwork that would ordinarily be "fees" in the traditional art market.

Through your involvement and vibrant storytelling, Art of Kindness creates a new story for all art lovers and philanthropists – which includes you, the artist or collector, the artwork, and the champion for social good. We will curate a new narrative for the art piece, as a unique Art of Kindness experience, for you to share on our platform.

We believe that art can be more than just a beautiful object that hangs on a wall – it can be part of your of legacy of kindness to make our world a more beautiful place – one artwork at a time. We invite you to build your social giving legacy with us. What do you want your story to be?

 

VISION

Our aim is to provide easy and transparent access to the art market, with the opportunity to do social good through art. We are creating a unique experience for people who may feel locked out of the marketplace or unsure of how they can get involved in giving back.

We will share the new stories where art lives – in both the virtual universe and through curated physical pop-up exhibitions.

Some key elements of our work are still under wraps, and we look forward to unveiling more of our vision in the months ahead. We hope to see you at our exhibition this fall in London where you can witness our work come alive, expressed through our artists, patrons, partners and the art loving crowd.

 

A NEW 'ART OF KINDNESS' CHAPTER IN A PIECE OF ART’S STORY

A piece of art’s value largely determined by its story.

A vast majority of the world’s art resides in a collector's home, on the walls of great institutions and museums or locked away in vaults, hidden from the rest of the world. Over the centuries, some pieces of art have accumulated exorbitant value simply by being in the hands of a historic figure. The great artists of history did not envisage their work resonating with others in the centuries to come. Their work merely reflected the environmental and socio-economic climate of the time in a way that had meaning to future generations. The starving artist, Vincent Van Gogh, would never have predicted his ‘Portrait of Dr. Gatchet’ would sell for $82.5 million in 1990.  The value of a piece of art is determined by its story – its origin, history, the artist’s intentions, and the perception and tastes of others.

Art of Kindness will not only leverage the intangible qualities and financial value of art to help fund social initiatives all over the world, we will also write a new chapter in the story of the art piece.

Through Art of Kindness, we are adding social layer to the artwork. A story that is current, but celebrates its history and alludes to its future. This allows you to view the art piece in a completely different way – one that now includes you and the benefit this piece of art has catalyzed.

 

TIMELINE

 

WHAT ARE THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES?

We are confident that this campaign will help us to showcase our exhibition. As we are a start-up, we have faced many challenges along the way, and it is inevitable that we will face more in the months ahead. However, we will continue to work through any roadblocks with perseverance, tenacity and dedication.

In the event that there are delays that significantly impact our schedule, we promise to communicate with full transparency. Our team is passionate about this initiative and is fully committed to managing the obstacles we might face along this journey in writing the next chapter of art’s story.  

 

END NOTE

We understand that not everyone can give financially, so support in any form helps! Remember, sharing the link with your family and friends can make a huge difference in helping us raise awareness and spread the word! Talk about Art of Kindness and what we are working towards. Please follow us on social media, and share us on yours. We invite you to join us in writing the next chapter of art's story.

PERKS!

Thank You Note from Founder (£25 )

Limited Edition Set of Humanity Greeting Cards by Artist Deanna First (£30)

Limited Edition, Flora Stationery Notebook Featuring Abstract Watercolor Artwork by Artist Besiana Kryeziu (£55)

Limited Edition, Small Batch T-shirt For Women Featuring Quote on Kindness by Artist Virginia Leonard (£75) 

Limited Edition Postcard Set Featuring Collage Artwork by artist Rita GT (£125)

Limited Edition, Hand Stitched Canvas and Leather Tote Featuring Photograph of Sculptural Artwork by Artist Seema Kohli  (£250)

Limited Edition, Original Digital Print Inspired by Elephant Family by Artist Nikolina Petolas (£500)

MEET THE TEAM

SPECIAL CREDITS

Thank you to the following people who made this campaign and all of its moving parts possible:

Indiegogo Video Film Credits: Ruth Powys, CEO Elephant Family;  Seema Kohli, Artist; Angharad Mckenzie, Head of Key Relationships charity: water; Jacqueline Novogratz, CEO Acumen; Anna Liu, Lead Architect, tonkin liu

Indiegogo Video Production Credits: Siddharth Devaraj, Daryl McCollin, xposure London; Aamir Patel; Amir Razi, idealistjack; Syd Richardson 

AoK and Exhibition Credits: tonkin liu; Imperial College Business School

Graphic Art and Illustrations: Anitha Balachandran (theseechange.com)

Graphic Art: Vivek Radhakrishnan
