SELECT AND PURCHASE YOUR ARTWORK         Our artists have exhibited all over the world, are renowned in their field, and personally advocate for social causes. They produce work across multiple mediums including painting, sculpture, photography and mixed media. They hail from all over the world: from New Zealand and India to the UK, Portugal and the US. Meet some of our artists:Petroc SestiPetroc Sesti is a London-based artist born in 1973, whose work is exhibited in museums and permanent collections around the world. He works in a variety of mediums exploring concepts of physics, cosmology and matter.Rita GTRita GT lives between Luanda, Angola and Viana do Castelo, Portugal. She is the founder of e-Studio Luanda – an active collaboration platform between Rita GT and other artists with a focus on art as critical thinking regarding Contemporary Art of Africa and the diaspora.Virginia LeonardThe highly individual and evocative ceramics of the Auckland based artist are honest self-portraits that address her bodily scarring and experiences of chronic pain, injuries obtained in a serious motorbike accident in London in 1986.Natvar BhavsarBorn in Gujarat, India in 1934, Bhavsar moved to the US in the early 1960’s, where he became an influential member of the New York School of Colorists. He is credited with easternizing the Color Field language through his use of thrown and sifted pigment.Nathan Slate Joseph An integral member of the New York School of Art for more than forty years, he blurs the boundary between painting and sculpture. Alluding to issues of globalization, immigration and climate change, he collects shards of discarded steel and stains them with raw pigment and acid.Seema KohliCelebrated Indian artist and visual storyteller whose work spans over three decades. Her paintings, drawings, and public murals are an extension of her creative growth and search for self.Revati Sharma SinghInternational contemporary artist who uses her art to showcase the issues that face Indian society. She currently uses her art for good, supporting charities based in Indian cities.Klaus ThymannDanish born multi-award winning photographer, filmmaker and creative director. He has developed an original viewpoint having worked across a wide range of subjects and media.Doug PattersonLondon based artist trained at the Royal College of Art. Combining art and architecture, he retraces the journeys of travelling artists and others through watercolour.Brinda MillerStudied Textile Design at Sir J.J. School of Art and Drawing and Painting at the Parsons School of Design, New York. Since 1982, Brinda has had 15 solo exhibitions and has been responsible for bringing public art to the city of Mumbai.2. PICK A CAUSE YOU LOVE AND SEE THE IMPACT CREATEDwww.acumen.orgwww.elephant-family.orgwww.charitywater.orgwww.project-pressure.orgwww.micrograam.comEach of our partners has a proven ability to deliver on their promise of building a better world in a very transparent and engaging way. Like Art of Kindness, storytelling is built into their mission.3. CELEBRATE AND SHARE WITH OTHERS (in the future on the AoK app) 4. BUILD YOUR LEGACY OF KINDNESS (in the future on www.artofkindness.co.uk platform)Art of Kindness is a new and exciting marketplace for art, where artists and collectors can discover, exhibit, buy, and sell art while giving to a cause they love. A portion of the proceeds from each sale is given to one of our social impact partners from all over the world. We share the same proceeds from the sale of the artwork that would ordinarily be "fees" in the traditional art market.Through your involvement and vibrant storytelling, Art of Kindness creates a new story for all art lovers and philanthropists – which includes you, the artist or collector, the artwork, and the champion for social good. We will curate a new narrative for the art piece, as a unique Art of Kindness experience, for you to share on our platform.We believe that art can be more than just a beautiful object that hangs on a wall – it can be part of your of legacy of kindness to make our world a more beautiful place – one artwork at a time. We invite you to build your social giving legacy with us. What do you want your story to be? VISIONOur aim is to provide easy and transparent access to the art market, with the opportunity to do social good through art. We are creating a unique experience for people who may feel locked out of the marketplace or unsure of how they can get involved in giving back.We will share the new stories where art lives – in both the virtual universe and through curated physical pop-up exhibitions.Some key elements of our work are still under wraps, and we look forward to unveiling more of our vision in the months ahead. We hope to see you at our exhibition this fall in London where you can witness our work come alive, expressed through our artists, patrons, partners and the art loving crowd. A NEW 'ART OF KINDNESS' CHAPTER IN A PIECE OF ART’S STORYA piece of art’s value largely determined by its story.A vast majority of the world’s art resides in a collector's home, on the walls of great institutions and museums or locked away in vaults, hidden from the rest of the world. Over the centuries, some pieces of art have accumulated exorbitant value simply by being in the hands of a historic figure. The great artists of history did not envisage their work resonating with others in the centuries to come. Their work merely reflected the environmental and socio-economic climate of the time in a way that had meaning to future generations. The starving artist, Vincent Van Gogh, would never have predicted his ‘Portrait of Dr. Gatchet’ would sell for $82.5 million in 1990.  The value of a piece of art is determined by its story – its origin, history, the artist’s intentions, and the perception and tastes of others.Art of Kindness will not only leverage the intangible qualities and financial value of art to help fund social initiatives all over the world, we will also write a new chapter in the story of the art piece.Through Art of Kindness, we are adding social layer to the artwork. A story that is current, but celebrates its history and alludes to its future. This allows you to view the art piece in a completely different way – one that now includes you and the benefit this piece of art has catalyzed. TIMELINE
 WHAT ARE THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES?We are confident that this campaign will help us to showcase our exhibition. As we are a start-up, we have faced many challenges along the way, and it is inevitable that we will face more in the months ahead. However, we will continue to work through any roadblocks with perseverance, tenacity and dedication.In the event that there are delays that significantly impact our schedule, we promise to communicate with full transparency. Our team is passionate about this initiative and is fully committed to managing the obstacles we might face along this journey in writing the next chapter of art’s story.   END NOTEWe understand that not everyone can give financially, so support in any form helps! Remember, sharing the link with your family and friends can make a huge difference in helping us raise awareness and spread the word! Talk about Art of Kindness and what we are working towards. Please follow us on social media, and share us on yours. We invite you to join us in writing the next chapter of art's story.PERKS!Thank You Note from Founder (£25 )Limited Edition Set of Humanity Greeting Cards by Artist Deanna First (£30)Limited Edition, Flora Stationery Notebook Featuring Abstract Watercolor Artwork by Artist Besiana Kryeziu (£55)Limited Edition, Small Batch T-shirt For Women Featuring Quote on Kindness by Artist Virginia Leonard (£75) Limited Edition Postcard Set Featuring Collage Artwork by artist Rita GT (£125)Limited Edition, Hand Stitched Canvas and Leather Tote Featuring Photograph of Sculptural Artwork by Artist Seema Kohli  (£250)Limited Edition, Original Digital Print Inspired by Elephant Family by Artist Nikolina Petolas (£500)MEET THE TEAMSPECIAL CREDITSThank you to the following people who made this campaign and all of its moving parts possible:Indiegogo Video Film Credits: Ruth Powys, CEO Elephant Family;  Seema Kohli, Artist; Angharad Mckenzie, Head of Key Relationships charity: water; Jacqueline Novogratz, CEO Acumen; Anna Liu, Lead Architect, tonkin liuIndiegogo Video Production Credits: Siddharth Devaraj, Daryl McCollin, xposure London; Aamir Patel; Amir Razi, idealistjack; Syd Richardson AoK and Exhibition Credits: tonkin liu; Imperial College Business SchoolGraphic Art and Illustrations: Anitha Balachandran (theseechange.com)Graphic Art: Vivek Radhakrishnan

story:
Summary

Hello world. My name is Emma Lu and since the end of 2012 I have found myself creating art, and lots of it! 

See, I didn't grow up in the nicest city, nor was my early education very good. Any belief in my creativity was gone by the time I found myself alone in the world. I lost my parents a few years apart from each other, an age when I was about to move into adulthood. I entered my 20's an orphan and up until my art, life was a struggle in some way, emotional or finding myself homeless for many years. 

I had nobody in the world to care about or to worry about me. But through grief a freedom was granted me, however hard it was to attain. I found myself a nomad, moving from hotel job to hotel job, anywhere they offered me a roof and food and small wage. I got to see some amazing places and meet some inspirational characters and although only 27 already have a few books to write about my journey so far. 

But honestly it was lonely, I never faced my grief because our culture is so scared of death and treats it like a taboo instead of a natural process. I finally wanted to just live a life again like I had before it was interrupted. I wanted to put to rest the grief and stitch up that scar. So I found myself in the Amazon Jungle drinking an alternative shamanic medicine to western science.

 Ayahuasca. It has been the most life changing process and a very positive one. Its a medicine and it was my last resort and the scariest step I ever took. I entered that experience not knowing what would come from it, just maybe a life I could live in again, but instead I left an artist. Suddenly my days were filled with drawings, then paintings. And it has not stopped or slowed down since. 

I'm not a scientist but I do feel I am proof to anybody who thinks this is just a trippy drug, that it is in fact exactly what the people who have been using in their culture say it is, medicine. As soon as I left the jungle 21/12/2012 I created a Facebook art page and ever since have been uploading my progress, art and journey with amazing feedback from all over the world.

I see the art I create is popular among people from all walks of life. Its self taught, its not been shaped by art school, and its hardly ever planned and it wont stop. I have done a lot of online networking with the world getting it out there. But now I need to go with it, because my art is my story. I don't put it all out there for sympathy (I don't need that). I put it out there because I know when I was at rock bottom I could have done with some Psychedelic Artist telling me "look it will be OK" through words or through their art. 

I need help with this, I buy canvas over food some days :) 

The basic outline of this trip is to start in Amsterdam. Most of the trip will be hard work and taking my art to places I feel would benefit from it, and as I am a Psychedelic Artist I would like to spend just a week or so networking Amsterdam Coffee shops with my artwork in person. From this part of the trip I hope to just get myself out there, maybe get some mural work and so forth.

From here I will go to Jerusalem. I have spent a lot of time in both Israel and Palestine and know a lot about this conflict. I spent a lot of time around the more war-torn regions and was completely blown away with the graffiti. I would like to spend a short amount of time in the area working on some graffiti with the message of peace, but in my own psychedelic way and something very different, even taboo for such a religious place (if in Jerusalem), but positive either way. I already have contacts there and places to stay and I plan to make good use of them with my art in person. 

From here I wish to visit Egypt. Since the revolution their has been an artistic explosion in the country and I also want to work more with political peaceful graffiti. I also want to network with one of my favorite authors and get some knowledge that will add to the depth of my artwork. 

Next stop is the USA. I am currently looking for locations to spend longer periods of time, networking and getting inspired. First I would start in New York, over the years on my travels I met many artistic friends from here and would love to get my artwork here as well as visiting Alex Grey's Chapel of Sacred Mirrors.

Then I will slowly make my way west. Colorado for around a month then California where I want to spend the most time with my art. It is mainly people from California who have been showing a lot of interest in my artwork since the early days so reaching here will be a very important step for my art and myself. I will work my arse of networking, displaying, graffiti, festivals, everything! And I will put more information on the places and  faces I am aiming for soon. :)

The final part of my journey is Mexico. This country has been calling me for years, I even dedicated my right arm to a big Mexican tattoo. I met some political graffiti artists from Mexico that I am still in touch with and would love a chance to see their art in action and join in. I also met another artist who has projects teaching kids art, which I would love to do. 

And that's all for now :) 

During the entire time at every chance I get, I will try and get as many people I can making art. Its good for you and you don't need an art degree to create art, we all have it in us, just like we all can learn to play an instrument if we try. I believe in areas where there is not much going on for the youth, or a lot of horrible stuff going on for the youth, the more psychedelic bright happy art the better. Art helps people dream, tunes up the imagination, makes people calm and can be a healthier escape option than other things. Since as young as I can remember that's all I wanted for the world but I had no idea how to do it. I'm going to give it a go with my art, dream big :) 

What We Need & What You Get 

So I pretty much have to go for days without food currently, its impossible for me to save any money. I have rent and my wage is below minimum as well as it being winter and not much work around....

I need help with this Please: 


  • Flights and Travel. UK - Amsterdam - Israel/Palestine -Egypt -USA -Mexico. This is what a lot of the money raised will be going on, I'm confident I can make a bit with my art along the way and I will sofa surf and volunteer for accommodation. I will try and do the transport costs for £2500 max but it may go over that target. 
  • The rest of the money will go on food, basic needs, emergencies, living and my art supply as I will have to get new stuff in each different country. I'm used to being broke, I can make money last a long time. 
  • If I don't reach my final goal the money will still go towards this trip, that will not change. Its happening somehow! And if I only raise maybe a few hundred pounds it will be the first savings towards this trip, and some desperately needed art supplies. 

The Impact

The impact from my trip is not just a personal goal I am aiming to reach, its larger than myself. I'm not a fan of the people who run things, but I am a fan of the underdog. I am that underdog and my art is proving already that dreams are possible no matter who you are or where you come from. The door is open and i'm partly through, I just need to jump, no fear, and really believe I can bring positive vibrations into this world with my art. Whats the point of happiness if you don't have the world to share it with? 

And if my most magical dreams come true and this art thing can turn into a living I hope to inspire others to KNOW you are everything you already need to be. Its all inside, with dedicated you can get there.

My story/art will also highlight the corruption within the War On Drugs and how some legal drugs are a lot more dangerous than illegal ones. I saw my parents face death, my mother unready and completely destroyed from her cancer treatment that took away her quality of life. We all die, stop fighting it and just go with it. I learnt from death how to live, my art is life. Thank you for your time. 

I'm a good trustworthy person, can get reference for that claim :)

Love.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the art <3 https://www.facebook.com/pages/Emma-Lu-Arts/435914796477708

story:
About Me

My name is Marg Thomson.

I am an award winning artist and photographer, published author and poet living in the glorious Yarra Valley in Victoria, Australia. I have successfully exhibited for more than 30 years and my work is in private, public and corporate collections 

I discovered the healing art of the mandala many years ago while learning to cope with recurrent episodes of mental illness and a series of tragic and heartbreaking deaths. I painted my way through darkness and depression into the light. 

In response to many requests I began working on a card deck, similar to Oracle and Tarot decks, with the aim of providing some of my most powerful mandalas in a readily accessible and tactile form. Thus the Mandala Meditations Guidance Card Oracle Deck was born. 

At the same time, I was working on the apps for iPhone and Android and 6 months after the deck was released in the physical form, the apps were released as well in both a free and paid version for both platforms. 

The Impact

The pure intent of the Mandala Meditations Guidance Card Deck is to facilitate your journey towards spiritual growth and self enlightenment. It is a tool to help clear your head of its busy-ness and allow your heart and your spirit to recharge and renew. I want to be able to provide the power and energy of these beautiful mandalas to the world so that all can reap the rewards. 

What I Need & What You Get

Additional expenses caused by manufacturing issues which resulted in multiple reprints and production delays has impacted sales to a huge extent and this, combined with my continuing ill health and the spiralling costs of living expenses as a widow, has resulted in me having to move to another home a long way from where I live now. 

The additional spiralling costs involved with keeping the Apps compliant has also added to the burden of being able to supply and provide the world with the Mandala Meditations Guidance Cards.

I'm seeking your support to be able to continue to provide the deck and the apps. 


I'm offering some amazing incentives to help you help me! 


I will be running big sales on my Facebook Business Page of all the other original art and prints and merchandise for you to check out.  http://www.facebook.com/pages/Marg-Thomson-Visionary-Artist/409222155794529

Please check out my webpage at http://fullcirclemandalas.weebly.com/indiegogo-campaign.html

The cards are here: http://fullcirclemandalas.weebly.com/

You can buy the apps for Android devices here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.margthomson.mandalacards&feature=search_result#?t=W251bGwsMSwyLDEsImNvbS5tYXJndGhvbXNvbi5tYW5kYWxhY2FyZHMiXQ..

And for Apple devices here: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mandala-meditations-guidance/id538379586?ls=1&mt=8


Other Ways You Can Help


Please spread the word.  Share Share Share :D

Tweet, post to Facebook, your Wordpress blog, Aeclectic Tarot Forum, or any other media you have access to. 

Thank you for your encouragement and support.

story:
Hi.

I'm Molly, the writer/director of this film. Me and my DOP Dave got together earlier this year and talked about how much we'd like to make this short, but what a shame that we couldn't because we didn't have the budget. Then we realised that actually maybe we could... by pulling in favours, by giving people the opportunity to gain credits, by selling our possessions and by being cheeky enough to ask you. So that's why I'm here, talking to you now. Hi. (Your hair looks great, btw). 

In these dark times, it feels good to laugh as well as cry and shout and get drunk and try to be better people. This is a film that will make you laugh as well as hopefully make you think, feel all the feelings and contemplate YOUR WHOLE PURPOSE IN LIFE. Or, you might at least smile and think, aww, bless them for having a go. 

This is a film about love and hope and family and people who talk too much. It's about a narcissistic comedian who's about to learn a massively important lesson, via a trip to a grim seaside town and an unexpected game of Dungeons and Dragons. 

Due to what I can only describe as witchcraft, I have somehow managed to bag an amazing cast consisting of the wonderful Paul Foxcroft, Sara Pascoe, Marcus Brigstocke and Charlotte Gittins. I have also cast some YOUNG PEOPLE - Martha, Louis and Jeremiah . I'm excited to give them an opportunity to do their first bit of film acting. Our co-lead is Cybil Cann, who is 14 and has the most excellent personality as well as genuinely mesmerising eyes. I need to stop telling her that though, apparently it's "creepy". (She does, though, and if you help fund this film you can see them for yourself. Then we'll see who's "being weird").  

Oh, you have some questions? Cool.

YOU: So Molly. Why should I contribute to this? 

ME: Good question. Also nice jumper. Well, it will be a really good film, hopefully. Also it will help me and Dave with our lives. He wants to get more experience as a DOP, I want to be a director. We realised that no one was going to help us gain those skills, we needed to do it ourselves! By which I mean, ask you. But most of all, it's going to be a really good film. 

YOU: Sounds good, if incredibly indulgent. But how do I know for sure that it's going to be decent? I don't want to throw my money at garbage. 

ME: Gosh no, nobody wants that. Well, what can I say. I have written some stuff already, for BBC Radio 4, for Sky One, and for a whole bunch of theatres, and other places. Dave is a renowned photographer and has made films before, too. This is not amateur-hour. We are very committed to making it good, and I refer you back to the excellent cast list to further convince you of the potential quality.

YOU: And what will you do with it once it is made?

ME: We will submit it to a bunch of festivals and see if it gets anywhere. Through this experience and the things we get to learn (inevitably due to our mistakes), we will have all learned how to make a filmmaking and will be able to continue to make work with the help of having this on our respective CVs. And YOU will have a lovely film to watch, and the knowledge that you did a Bloody Good Deed. If you have even read this far, I'm extremely grateful! If you can't chuck us any quids right now, sharing or sending to someone else is also very helpful. 

Here are some pictures of us rehearsing and location scouting to show you how into it we all are, even when it's windy.
story_txt:
Hi.
I'm Molly, the writer/director of this film. Me and my DOP Dave got together earlier this year and talked about how much we'd like to make this short, but what a shame that we couldn't because we didn't have the budget. Then we realised that actually maybe we could... by pulling in favours, by giving people the opportunity to gain credits, by selling our possessions and by being cheeky enough to ask you. So that's why I'm here, talking to you now. Hi. (Your hair looks great, btw). 
In these dark times, it feels good to laugh as well as cry and shout and get drunk and try to be better people. This is a film that will make you laugh as well as hopefully make you think, feel all the feelings and contemplate YOUR WHOLE PURPOSE IN LIFE. Or, you might at least smile and think, aww, bless them for having a go. 
This is a film about love and hope and family and people who talk too much. It's about a narcissistic comedian who's about to learn a massively important lesson, via a trip to a grim seaside town and an unexpected game of Dungeons and Dragons. 
Due to what I can only describe as witchcraft, I have somehow managed to bag an amazing cast consisting of the wonderful Paul Foxcroft, Sara Pascoe, Marcus Brigstocke and Charlotte Gittins. I have also cast some YOUNG PEOPLE - Martha, Louis and Jeremiah . I'm excited to give them an opportunity to do their first bit of film acting. Our co-lead is Cybil Cann, who is 14 and has the most excellent personality as well as genuinely mesmerising eyes. I need to stop telling her that though, apparently it's "creepy". (She does, though, and if you help fund this film you can see them for yourself. Then we'll see who's "being weird").  
Oh, you have some questions? Cool.

ME: Good question. Also nice jumper. Well, it will be a really good film, hopefully. Also it will help me and Dave with our lives. He wants to get more experience as a DOP, I want to be a director. We realised that no one was going to help us gain those skills, we needed to do it ourselves! By which I mean, ask you. But most of all, it's going to be a really good film. 
YOU: Sounds good, if incredibly indulgent. But how do I know for sure that it's going to be decent? I don't want to throw my money at garbage. 
ME: Gosh no, nobody wants that. Well, what can I say. I have written some stuff already, for BBC Radio 4, for Sky One, and for a whole bunch of theatres, and other places. Dave is a renowned photographer and has made films before, too. This is not amateur-hour. We are very committed to making it good, and I refer you back to the excellent cast list to further convince you of the potential quality.
YOU: And what will you do with it once it is made?
ME: We will submit it to a bunch of festivals and see if it gets anywhere. Through this experience and the things we get to learn (inevitably due to our mistakes), we will have all learned how to make a filmmaking and will be able to continue to make work with the help of having this on our respective CVs. And YOU will have a lovely film to watch, and the knowledge that you did a Bloody Good Deed. If you have even read this far, I'm extremely grateful! If you can't chuck us any quids right now, sharing or sending to someone else is also very helpful. 
Here are some pictures of us rehearsing and location scouting to show you how into it we all are, even when it's windy.

story:
What is "Spirit of the Smokies"

"Spirit of the Smokies" is a passion project for artist Willy Adkins. Adkins was inspired by his life long love of the Smoky's and after a few years of park research and planning, he began the project in 2006 with the ultimate goal of publishing a coffee table photo book featuring the natural beauty of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Since beginning the project, it has now grown to include a feature length DVD and also a soundtrack CD both featuring original music by Dc McAuliffe (www.dcmcauliffe.com).

What We Need To Finish This Project

Still needed to complete the Book/Movie/Soundtrack:

  • 2 to 3 trips back to the national park (I'm located in Illinois) to finish off Photo & Video including Black Bear, Elk, Autumn colors and possibly winter scenes.  (This obviously involves costs in travel, my largest expence in this project and equipment rentals).
  • Book proofing, editing (as I hope to include inspirational quotes and/or information about the Smokies) and printing (hardcover don't come cheap).
  • For the movie, post production software, original music score, DVD menu design (and software), physical DVD copies and two hard drives.
  • For the soundtrack album, original music, jewel case design, physical CD copies.
  • And of course marketing and advertising of all the various media types.

The Impact

As the creator of this nearly decade long passion project that has been inspired by a life long love for the natural beauty and serenity of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park, seeing this all come together into a finished product will be a joy comparable to welcoming a new child to the family.  The creation of this project has brought me peace within the suroundings and my entire purpose is that feeling with all of you through various media.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?  No worries!  You can help in other ways!

  • SHARE this campaign page with friends and family!  By spreading the word, they might be able to contribute and even if they can't, they might share it to someone who can.  At the same time, you are helping spread the word and build awareness of what we are doing.. Word of mouth marketing is the best!
  • PARTNER WITH WILLY ON A TRIP!  That's right, make contact with Willy privately about possibly joining him on one of the 2 - 3 travels back to the Smoky's as he finishes up.  Spliting costs makes this all so much easier, gives him some company and lets you too experience the natural beauty of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park first hand! (this does involve some hicking and is out amongst wildlife, just an early caution).
  • VISIT, LIKE AND OFFER POSITIVE WORDS on our facebook fan page (linked below)! Then share it with your friends!  Several of the earliest images shot for this project can be seen there!

THANK YOU!

Thank you for taking the time to even peek at this page!  This entire project is about natural beauty, positive thinking and serenity.  I hope that you will be a part of something so beautiful!  ~ Willy Adkins

A photo I took of my father Kenny Adkins during my last travel to The Smoky's at Abrams Falls.  It was a 5 mile hike to get there and probably the last time he will ever attempt to do anything like that again.  This photo certainly carries much value to him and I both.

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Cliff and I am an artist with a focus on digital painting though I also  work in acrylic, graphite, charcoal, marker and colored pencil. 


You might know me from Google Plus where I have become known for my Speedpaint Hangouts in which I paint people digitally in G+ video calls while they watch. Perhaps you know me through YouTube where I post videos of me creating artwork. Though if you are reading this its more likely we know each other through various FB GWAR groups or the MySpace ones before that. 

Suffice it to say I am a huge GWAR fan hence all the GWAR  'fan art'  you see on this page.  I lost track of how many times I have seen them play over the years but I am sure it has been at least 20. Probably many more.  One thing I have never been able to do though, is make my way down to Richmond VA for the annual GWAR B Q. 

The reason for this is either A. it fell out on my daughter's birthday. or B. I am what is known as a 'Broke-Hab' With a family of 8 to feed, house and keep clothed, having enough extra money to justify the trip just hasn't happened.  I am hoping, with your help, that I can change that this year.

I am hoping to raise  $959 which will go towards:

  • Transportation down to Richmond (most likely via Amtrak) 
  • 3 nights at a hotel
  • My GBQ ticket
  • Food and drink
  • Transportation while in Richmond
  • Merch.  

Any additional money raised will go towards my independent artist projects which I will keep you apprised of as they develop.  

What you can get:

Slymie Takes a Ride  5.5" x 8.5" Print: $10


Its Not Easy Being Green  9" x 12" Print: $20 (Original $ 150)


Flattus in Orange 9" x 12" Print: $20


Balsac in Green 9" x 12" Print: $20

Phoenix Taking Flight 9" x 12" Print: $20

Medusa 9" x 12" Print: $20

Hell Stumps 11" x 14" Print: $30

The Eye 11" x 14" Print: $30

Lulu 11" x 14" Print: $30  (Contact me if you would like to commission a Digital Painting like this of your pet!) 

Oderus and the Amber Eye 11" x 14" Print: $30 ($500 for the original)

Jizmak Da Gusha  11" x 14" Print: $30

Flattus Maximus 11" x 14" Print: $30

Beefcake the Mighty 11" x 14" Print: $30

Sleazy P. Martini 11" x 14" Print: $30

Pustulus Maximus 11" x 14" Print: $30

Oderus Urungus 11" x 14" Print: $30

Balsac the Jaws of Death 11" x 14" Print: $30

Venomous Balsac 11" x 14" Print: $30

story:
Help Bring Glass Blowing to 

The Glass Studio

The Glass Studio wants to bring glass blowing classes in house. We're an almost full service glass studio that offers a retail and gallery space, fabrication services and instruction in many glass techniques such as torch work and glass bead making, kiln forming, which includes fusing, slumping and casting, mosaic, and jewelry making. We want to add glass blowing. that's why we're here. We need a bit of assistance to buy a glory hole, which is the piece of equipment that allows the glass blower to reheat the gather their working with after shaping or adding color to it. We're having it custom built to accommodate our limited space. We do have most of the other tools and equipment that we'll need, such as the kilns and poles and bench and the jacks and blocks...
To entice your contributions we are offering some goodies and discounted classes. The classes we'll teach will be how to make paperweights and tumblers and small sculptures. So these are some of the things we're offering to you, our contributors...
We know that not everyone can chip in, what we do hope for is that you'll at least spread the word. Let your friends know this is a good cause. But if you want to learn about glass blowing, now's your chance...check out the perks below and see if there's anything you'd like. Tell us your color preferences if you want a paperweight or tumbler...we can do it. Or get a multipack of classes, the more you get the more you save. And thanks so much for taking the time to check out our little campaign!

story:
Introducing My First Feature Film: VIOLET!

Hello everyone reading this, my name is Samuel Vainisi and this campaign is to help raise finishing funds for my first feature film 'Violet'. Me and my amazing cast / crew have shot 85 percent of the movie! As I am typing this we only have another day of filming left to go to completely wrap principal photography! 

 

NOW, let's proceed to what VIOLET is about now shall we?

 

The Story of VIOLET

Moments after being brutally violated, a once starry eyed girl named Violet wonders through the night traumatized and completely changed. Violet begins to track down the men who have hurt her, determined not to be a compliant victim anymore, and take matters into  her own hands. During her blood-soaked journey, she meets a boy named Josh at the one place she gets solace - her favorite lake. Will Josh give her the closure she needs or will revenge be the only way for her to heal?

 

 

                                   Teaser Poster for Violet - Artwork by 'Martin Trafford'

 

                       

Why Crowdfunding?

Why Crowdfunding? Well that's simple! It's because I'm broke. I can't afford to go into anymore debt from this project and I have bills of my own coming up soon, you know...life... this is where crowdfunding comes in. Me and my cast/crew would love to finish the film over a weekend in October and we need your help! The goal is only 3000 but that will help cover costs on set with actors, sound, etc. But that will also cover post production costs to cover the score (composed by Justin Burning) AND get the poster artwork commissioned (artwork by Simon Pritchard). WHATEVER is funded after the goal will help me get rid of the debt I have aquired from doing this project and if somehow I'm able to raise even more than that - every penny will go towards my next feature film 'Scarlett'. 

 

Now, let's get to the good stuff!

The Cast of VIOLET

 

                                                                Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

Before working with Alyss Winkler (Plank Face, Space Babes from Outer Space) on my previous short film 'Breathe', I had no plans on doing Violet. I wanted to wait and be confident enough in myself, and wanted to find someone who can do this role. Because getting in Violet's head is such a dark place to go to and I had no idea who could do this role and could do it justice... then I worked with Alyss. Halfway through shooting my short film, I was a bit mad at myself. I was like 'why am I doing this, when I can do Violet?' I knew I was ready that moment and I knew I could tackle something much larger than that simple short. The short primarily was a test short, to see if I was even ready for a bigger project. And... pretty much after working with Alyss, I could only see her doing this role. She IS Violet. 

 

One of my favorite reviews of Breathe is linked down below :)

https://www.pophorror.com/samuel-vainisis-2018-...

 

                                                                 Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

I've always been a fan of Jason Crowe (Harvest Lake, The Bad Man). He is actually my favorite indie actor to date... I've said this publicly before, but I'm going to say it again. Jason is just one of those rare guys who is amazing on and off set. He is such a down to earth guy and is such a blast to work with. Interesting enough, Jason has also been following my film-making journey since the start. He backed my first ever short Senses and he has been watching me grow over the short years. I was going to ask if he'd be interested in doing a short film... but then I met Alyss and well... the rest is history now.

 

                                                                   Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

Ember Burns is such a great actress and such a funny individual on and off set. Ember is mostly a model but does film work here and there and honestly she needs more credit than she is given. I'm excited to eventually release this film to show people what she can really do.

 

                                                                     Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

Justin Tsanta... this guy was actually my very first producer. He believed in me since the beginning with my short film Senses and he has been by my side ever since. He also is a sick tattoo artist and artist in general. He also did the DVD cover art for my second short film 'Akrasia'. It was a pleasure having him on set, this was actually the first time we ever met in person and we just clicked and starting shooting scenes :)

 

                                                             Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

Brian Papandrea (Space Babes from Outer Space, The Big F) is mostly known for his comedic roles, but in this film he plays a more serious and quite frankly terrifying role in Violet. He absolutely killed it... I've never seen this side of Brian before and it just chilled me to the core (in a good way). He took what I wrote and made it ten time better. I was actually nervous about his scenes, those scenes in general were the scenes I was the most nervous about, but it turned out to be my favorite scenes to shoot AND favorite sequence in the entire movie! Brian is such a committed actor, he is willing to put himself out there and try new things and really give it his all with every role.

 

                                                               Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

Jennie Osterman is a bit newer to acting, but man did she deliver in this film. She is such a sweet heart on and off of set, I don't know where she gets all those positive vibes but can I please steal them? Jennie was able to dip her toes in a role with this film and she even told me she wants to do even more of them and she should! With even more practicing and just being in front of a camera, I see Jennie going places in the independent scene <3 

 

                                                                 Screen grab from 'Violet'

 

Keith Voigt Jr. actually was the first person I met in person from the independent scene. I went to my very first horror convention with my copy of Redsin Tower in my backpack. I wanted to meet Fred Vogel to get it signed and also a few other people I wanted to meet from the Indie scene. Back then in 2015, I was just getting really into the scene and I tried to support as many independent artists as I could. And with this con, I also went to meet Marcus Koch and Stephen Biro in person! But Keith stood out... It started out as a usual conversation does when you go to cons. Someone tries to get your attention to possibly buy some dvd's, but then I pulled out my own copy and showed I was a fan and things changed. It was like we were friends right then and there. When I was getting my stuff to leave the con, Keith actually found me and gave me a copy of his short films for free. I still have that DVD and whenever I look at it, I always remember that awesome day and how great of a guy he was. -- story time over... Keith also kills it in this movie. He plays a creep pretty much and I couldn't be more happier. 

 

 

Martin Trafford has been my main go to artist for the past two years now. I love this man and everything he has done for me. He has done artwork for my novel 'Unlocking The Truth', illustrations for my novella 'Agony & Pleasure',  DVD art for Senses, Akrasia and Breathe and COUNTLESS other pieces. This guy is a legend in the indie scene and a true friend. He also has a small cameo in Violet as Jason (over the phone because he is from Australia).

 

 

I met Samuel Thompson on the set of 'The Bad Man' and he amazed me right from the start. He also taught me all the basics of film-making on set. That film set was my very first time being apart of a crew and actually creating something. I had no idea what to do going into it, but after the experience only a few weeks later I began doing my own shorts. But that is going into my own story... anyways back to Sam. I was pretty amazed by how much knowledge Sam had with sound and all the little things that go into it. I was even more captivated with him once I saw the first trailer for the film drop, the sound was crystal clear and just perfect in every way. Right then and there I knew I had to contact him about recording sound for one of my films down the line... and a year and a half later it happened :)

 

 

I am so thrilled that Justin Burning is the composer for Violet! He scored the teaser trailer for the film, to give you an idea of how amazing he is. I honestly had no idea of Justin until I heard his music in 'The Bad Man', and I was just floored. He is one of the best in the indie scene to date and from what I heard from Scott Schirmer, the director of 'The Bad Man', he is a pleasure to work. Honestly, this film wouldn't be as good without him and I am so thrilled to have him on board!

 

 

Simon Pritchard will be the artist that is going to design the DVD / Poster art. Back earlier in the year, I saw previous work he did on another indie film titled 'Chickens Blood' and I was amazed by the quality of the piece. I also found out he hand paints the pieces and I'm not going to lie I stalked his facebook hahah. I looked through all of his photos and looked at the paintings he did that he commissioned and ones he just did to do and right then and there I contacted him and asked him if he'd be interested in doing a piece for me... and I haven't changed my mind since. This guy is seriously amazing and I cannot wait to see what he designs for the film.

 

                                                     Behind The Scenes Photo of 'Violet'

 

 

HERE ARE THE PERKS THAT INCLUDE PHOTOS (MOSTLY PROP SECTION)

 

                                                                      'Akrasia' Wardrobe

 

Screen grab from 'Akrasia'

 

Senses, Akrasia and Breathe (from left to right)

 

Josh's Grey Hoodie from 'Violet'

 

Pink Wig from 'Violet'

 

SCREEN WORN RIPPED UP GREEN FLANNEL AND WOODEN POCKET KNIFE FROM 'VIOLET'

 

DRESS LIKE VIOLET! - BLACK HOODIE, RED BEANIE AND POCKET KNIFE FROM 'VIOLET'

 

Violet's Backpack and Notebook

 

Ski Mask from 'Violet'

 

HARVEST LAKE TENTACLE #1

 

HARVEST LAKE TENTACLE #2

 

BLOODY OUTFIT #1

 

BLOODY OUTFIT #2

 

BLOODY BANDAGES FROM 'VIOLET' - INCLUDED WITH THE BLOODY OUTFIT #2 PERK

 

GUN PROP FROM 'VIOLET'

 

RED WOODS PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM

 

ORIGINAL ARTWORK FROM 'SENSES'  BY 'JOE MEREDITH'

 

SCRIPT OF 'VIOLET' (needs more autographs)

 

UNDER THE MOON PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Brittany Blanton)

 

I WAIT BEYOND THE TREES PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Brittany Blanton)

 

UNDER THE SKIN PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Brittany Blanton)

 

SERPENTS MEDUSA - MAIN PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Adam Mickey McAndrew's and Alyss Winkler)

 

CHEST PIECE #1 FROM 'VIOLET'

 

LAPTOP PROP FROM 'VIOLET' (works perfect too)

 

 

NEW PERK ADDED!

 

MARTIN TRAFFORD DESIGNED THESE PORTRAITS BELOW. BY CHOOSING THE 'TRAFFART PORTRAIT' PERK - YOU CAN GET YOUR OWN PORTRAIT DONE IN THE SAME STYLE AS THE TWO BELOW :)

 

 

 

 

Can You Handle Reality? - Making Violet

 

 

Violet has been a work in progress for the past three years. It's a story that means a lot to me and will hopefully have a positive impact in the community. It is a dark movie, it does deal with a lot of heavy touchy subjects, mostly showcasing the lingering trauma from the attack, but that's the point. Reality is scary and most people try and ignore that, but this film opens your closed eyelids wide open and shows you what people are truly capable of. When I say open your eyes, the film doesn't include a twenty minute rape scene like a lot of 'rape/revenge' movies do. This film starts AFTER the event and we focus on the character more than the lead up and the event itself. When we do show some footage from it, I made sure not to show any nudity. I didn't want to turn anyone on while watching this, I wanted to make you the audience feel disgusted. Because that's what rape is. It's disgusting... and it's fucked up that people just brush it off like it's just 'sex'........ no, it can completely change a person and fuck them up for LIFE... it's not just 'sex'.

 

Why should YOU donate to this campaign?

 

My first feature film Violet is 85 percent shot. This film at the end of the day will be finished and delivered to your doorstep soon. This is not a campaign in pre-production, this is also not a campaign that will screw you over. I haven't been in the independent scene that long and I don't know how good my word is... but I've seen people get screwed over with Kickstarter and Indiegogo campaigns... trust me, I've been in those situations too. Actually still waiting for a few of those campaigns to either refund me or send me something haha. So I get it. But this campaign WILL NOT be like that. I have only done three Indiegogo campaigns in the past, but with each of those I made sure to ship as soon as possible and make sure everyone got their perks safe and sound. I love independent film community with all my heart and I want to see it continue to flourish and grow. 

ALSO keep in mind that the perks could ship earlier than 'March 2020'. I only put March down just in case if the score was taking a while or the artwork or whatever. I hope to have everything finished before the end of the year - but if it does go any longer it will not surpass March of 2020... that I can assure you.

 

Stretch Goal Information

 

IF I'm able to surpass my goal and reach a crazy number I never was able to believe, like I don't even know If I'll raise 3000, but If I do - I have stretch goals in mind that are reallllllly cool extra goodies. I really wanted to use this Kickstarter to raise funds my next feature, but now I have to use it to finish the movie / pay off debt... but if I'm able to raise more to pay off debt / finish the movie, all of the extra funds go straight into my next feature film 'Scarlett' <3 

 

Closing Information

 

This is my first feature film. This film means the world to me. With every film, short or feature, I have done more than simply make a film. I've poured my soul into these scripts. Pieces of myself are scattered within these stories. Making films isn't just about making them, it's more than that to me. It's about telling a meaningful story. So, please... please help me finish this movie.

 

Kaylee Williams, Alyss Winkler, Keith Voigt Jr, Samuel Vainisi and Jason Crowe (from left to right)

 

Alyss Winkler, Jason Crowe, Andres Boeta, Jessi Winston, Samuel Vainisi and Samuel Thompson (from left to right)
story_txt: Introducing My First Feature Film: VIOLET!Hello everyone reading this, my name is Samuel Vainisi and this campaign is to help raise finishing funds for my first feature film 'Violet'. Me and my amazing cast / crew have shot 85 percent of the movie! As I am typing this we only have another day of filming left to go to completely wrap principal photography!  NOW, let's proceed to what VIOLET is about now shall we? The Story of VIOLETMoments after being brutally violated, a once starry eyed girl named Violet wonders through the night traumatized and completely changed. Violet begins to track down the men who have hurt her, determined not to be a compliant victim anymore, and take matters into  her own hands. During her blood-soaked journey, she meets a boy named Josh at the one place she gets solace - her favorite lake. Will Josh give her the closure she needs or will revenge be the only way for her to heal?                                     Teaser Poster for Violet - Artwork by 'Martin Trafford'                        Why Crowdfunding?Why Crowdfunding? Well that's simple! It's because I'm broke. I can't afford to go into anymore debt from this project and I have bills of my own coming up soon, you know...life... this is where crowdfunding comes in. Me and my cast/crew would love to finish the film over a weekend in October and we need your help! The goal is only 3000 but that will help cover costs on set with actors, sound, etc. But that will also cover post production costs to cover the score (composed by Justin Burning) AND get the poster artwork commissioned (artwork by Simon Pritchard). WHATEVER is funded after the goal will help me get rid of the debt I have aquired from doing this project and if somehow I'm able to raise even more than that - every penny will go towards my next feature film 'Scarlett'.  Now, let's get to the good stuff!The Cast of VIOLET                                                                 Screen grab from 'Violet' Before working with Alyss Winkler (Plank Face, Space Babes from Outer Space) on my previous short film 'Breathe', I had no plans on doing Violet. I wanted to wait and be confident enough in myself, and wanted to find someone who can do this role. Because getting in Violet's head is such a dark place to go to and I had no idea who could do this role and could do it justice... then I worked with Alyss. Halfway through shooting my short film, I was a bit mad at myself. I was like 'why am I doing this, when I can do Violet?' I knew I was ready that moment and I knew I could tackle something much larger than that simple short. The short primarily was a test short, to see if I was even ready for a bigger project. And... pretty much after working with Alyss, I could only see her doing this role. She IS Violet.  One of my favorite reviews of Breathe is linked down below :)https://www.pophorror.com/samuel-vainisis-2018-...                                                                  Screen grab from 'Violet' I've always been a fan of Jason Crowe (Harvest Lake, The Bad Man). He is actually my favorite indie actor to date... I've said this publicly before, but I'm going to say it again. Jason is just one of those rare guys who is amazing on and off set. He is such a down to earth guy and is such a blast to work with. Interesting enough, Jason has also been following my film-making journey since the start. He backed my first ever short Senses and he has been watching me grow over the short years. I was going to ask if he'd be interested in doing a short film... but then I met Alyss and well... the rest is history now.                                                                    Screen grab from 'Violet' Ember Burns is such a great actress and such a funny individual on and off set. Ember is mostly a model but does film work here and there and honestly she needs more credit than she is given. I'm excited to eventually release this film to show people what she can really do.                                                                      Screen grab from 'Violet' Justin Tsanta... this guy was actually my very first producer. He believed in me since the beginning with my short film Senses and he has been by my side ever since. He also is a sick tattoo artist and artist in general. He also did the DVD cover art for my second short film 'Akrasia'. It was a pleasure having him on set, this was actually the first time we ever met in person and we just clicked and starting shooting scenes :)                                                              Screen grab from 'Violet' Brian Papandrea (Space Babes from Outer Space, The Big F) is mostly known for his comedic roles, but in this film he plays a more serious and quite frankly terrifying role in Violet. He absolutely killed it... I've never seen this side of Brian before and it just chilled me to the core (in a good way). He took what I wrote and made it ten time better. I was actually nervous about his scenes, those scenes in general were the scenes I was the most nervous about, but it turned out to be my favorite scenes to shoot AND favorite sequence in the entire movie! Brian is such a committed actor, he is willing to put himself out there and try new things and really give it his all with every role.                                                                Screen grab from 'Violet' Jennie Osterman is a bit newer to acting, but man did she deliver in this film. She is such a sweet heart on and off of set, I don't know where she gets all those positive vibes but can I please steal them? Jennie was able to dip her toes in a role with this film and she even told me she wants to do even more of them and she should! With even more practicing and just being in front of a camera, I see Jennie going places in the independent scene <3                                                                   Screen grab from 'Violet' Keith Voigt Jr. actually was the first person I met in person from the independent scene. I went to my very first horror convention with my copy of Redsin Tower in my backpack. I wanted to meet Fred Vogel to get it signed and also a few other people I wanted to meet from the Indie scene. Back then in 2015, I was just getting really into the scene and I tried to support as many independent artists as I could. And with this con, I also went to meet Marcus Koch and Stephen Biro in person! But Keith stood out... It started out as a usual conversation does when you go to cons. Someone tries to get your attention to possibly buy some dvd's, but then I pulled out my own copy and showed I was a fan and things changed. It was like we were friends right then and there. When I was getting my stuff to leave the con, Keith actually found me and gave me a copy of his short films for free. I still have that DVD and whenever I look at it, I always remember that awesome day and how great of a guy he was. -- story time over... Keith also kills it in this movie. He plays a creep pretty much and I couldn't be more happier.   Martin Trafford has been my main go to artist for the past two years now. I love this man and everything he has done for me. He has done artwork for my novel 'Unlocking The Truth', illustrations for my novella 'Agony & Pleasure',  DVD art for Senses, Akrasia and Breathe and COUNTLESS other pieces. This guy is a legend in the indie scene and a true friend. He also has a small cameo in Violet as Jason (over the phone because he is from Australia).  I met Samuel Thompson on the set of 'The Bad Man' and he amazed me right from the start. He also taught me all the basics of film-making on set. That film set was my very first time being apart of a crew and actually creating something. I had no idea what to do going into it, but after the experience only a few weeks later I began doing my own shorts. But that is going into my own story... anyways back to Sam. I was pretty amazed by how much knowledge Sam had with sound and all the little things that go into it. I was even more captivated with him once I saw the first trailer for the film drop, the sound was crystal clear and just perfect in every way. Right then and there I knew I had to contact him about recording sound for one of my films down the line... and a year and a half later it happened :)  I am so thrilled that Justin Burning is the composer for Violet! He scored the teaser trailer for the film, to give you an idea of how amazing he is. I honestly had no idea of Justin until I heard his music in 'The Bad Man', and I was just floored. He is one of the best in the indie scene to date and from what I heard from Scott Schirmer, the director of 'The Bad Man', he is a pleasure to work. Honestly, this film wouldn't be as good without him and I am so thrilled to have him on board!  Simon Pritchard will be the artist that is going to design the DVD / Poster art. Back earlier in the year, I saw previous work he did on another indie film titled 'Chickens Blood' and I was amazed by the quality of the piece. I also found out he hand paints the pieces and I'm not going to lie I stalked his facebook hahah. I looked through all of his photos and looked at the paintings he did that he commissioned and ones he just did to do and right then and there I contacted him and asked him if he'd be interested in doing a piece for me... and I haven't changed my mind since. This guy is seriously amazing and I cannot wait to see what he designs for the film.                                                      Behind The Scenes Photo of 'Violet'  HERE ARE THE PERKS THAT INCLUDE PHOTOS (MOSTLY PROP SECTION)                                                                       'Akrasia' Wardrobe Screen grab from 'Akrasia' Senses, Akrasia and Breathe (from left to right) Josh's Grey Hoodie from 'Violet' Pink Wig from 'Violet' SCREEN WORN RIPPED UP GREEN FLANNEL AND WOODEN POCKET KNIFE FROM 'VIOLET' DRESS LIKE VIOLET! - BLACK HOODIE, RED BEANIE AND POCKET KNIFE FROM 'VIOLET' Violet's Backpack and Notebook Ski Mask from 'Violet' HARVEST LAKE TENTACLE #1 HARVEST LAKE TENTACLE #2 BLOODY OUTFIT #1 BLOODY OUTFIT #2 BLOODY BANDAGES FROM 'VIOLET' - INCLUDED WITH THE BLOODY OUTFIT #2 PERK GUN PROP FROM 'VIOLET' RED WOODS PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM ORIGINAL ARTWORK FROM 'SENSES'  BY 'JOE MEREDITH' SCRIPT OF 'VIOLET' (needs more autographs) UNDER THE MOON PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Brittany Blanton) I WAIT BEYOND THE TREES PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Brittany Blanton) UNDER THE SKIN PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Brittany Blanton) SERPENTS MEDUSA - MAIN PAINTING FROM VIOLET'S BEDROOM (by Adam Mickey McAndrew's and Alyss Winkler) CHEST PIECE #1 FROM 'VIOLET' LAPTOP PROP FROM 'VIOLET' (works perfect too)  NEW PERK ADDED! MARTIN TRAFFORD DESIGNED THESE PORTRAITS BELOW. BY CHOOSING THE 'TRAFFART PORTRAIT' PERK - YOU CAN GET YOUR OWN PORTRAIT DONE IN THE SAME STYLE AS THE TWO BELOW :)    Can You Handle Reality? - Making Violet  Violet has been a work in progress for the past three years. I haven't been in the independent scene that long and I don't know how good my word is... but I've seen people get screwed over with Kickstarter and Indiegogo campaigns... trust me, I've been in those situations too. Actually still waiting for a few of those campaigns to either refund me or send me something haha. So I get it. But this campaign WILL NOT be like that. I have only done three Indiegogo campaigns in the past, but with each of those I made sure to ship as soon as possible and make sure everyone got their perks safe and sound. I love independent film community with all my heart and I want to see it continue to flourish and grow. ALSO keep in mind that the perks could ship earlier than 'March 2020'. I hope to have everything finished before the end of the year - but if it does go any longer it will not surpass March of 2020... that I can assure you. Stretch Goal Information IF I'm able to surpass my goal and reach a crazy number I never was able to believe, like I don't even know If I'll raise 3000, but If I do - I have stretch goals in mind that are reallllllly cool extra goodies. story:
Cascadia Poetry Festival 2014!

The 2nd annual Cascadia Poetry Festival is May 1-4 at Seattle University & Spring Street Center, is a grassroots, volunteer based international event 100% powered by you!   

Over the course of the weekend, hundreds of artists, writers, scientists and activists will gather to explore, construct and bioregionally animate Cascadia to discover and foster deeper connection between all inhabitants and the place itself. We want to hear the bioregion speak through poetry, dialog and through the conversations that happen organically when creative and conscious people gather with the intent of discovery.

The festival features Academic, Democratic and Performance components, late night readings, a Small Press Fair and one workshop. Some of the best poetry minds in the bioregion, many Canadians not well known in the U.S., will gather, discuss this place and begin to better understand Cascadia and our role here.

All costs are raised by supporting organizations and individuals, and we need your help to ensure we can provide quality lodging and travel reimbursement to participating poets. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Right now we need to raise $2800 to pay headliner poets. All funds raised will go to paying the poets expenses. 
  • $30 for a Gold Pass, a Cascadia sticker and map of the bioregion.
  • $80 for two Gold Passes, a 3'x5' nylon Cascadia flag, a sticker and map of the bioregion.
  • $110 for entry into the Daphne Marlatt Workshop, a Gold Pass, a Cascadia sticker and map of the bioregion.
  • $125 for 4 Gold Passes, a Cascadia sticker, a 3'x5' nylon Cascadia flag and map of the bioregion.
  • $250 - an afternoon of Tea and Bourbon and overnight stay with Red Pine for you and a guest in Port Townsend. The legendary translator of Chinese poetry and sacred Buddhist texts, Red Pine has agreed to host two different couples for an overnight stay in his quaint A-Frame cottage including afternoon tea & evening bourbon. (2 couples at $250 per pair.)

  • $515 for a sushi dinner with Sam Hamill, founder of Copper Canyon press and Paul Nelson, executive director and founder of SPLAB and the Cascadia Poetry Festival with two or three other guests of your choosing - at Sakura in Burlington, Washington, an amazing sushi bar. Sake is included and Sam can talk about his poetry life in Casadia, the influence of Asian and Indigenous wisdom cultures on Cascadian culture and his own translations. Paul will be happy to discuss the festival, future festival plans and other associated projects. 

The Impact

We live in a bioregion that has been settled rather recently compared to other parts of the world and is one of the most beautiful and wild places left on the planet, with mountains, volcanoes, glaciers, rainforests, islands, waterfalls, fjords and many other remarkable natural features. But because of the recent settlement, the culture here is still largely undefined. We hope to discover and help define that culture in a way that is more just, sustainable and diverse in every sense of the word. Your contribution aids that process.

  • This festival is the largest bioregional gathering of poets in Cascadia history.
  • The first Cascadia Poetry Festival happened at SPLAB in Seattle in 2012.
  • Full funding for this festival will help assure the fest continues in future years, in a similar grass roots way, with local steering committees using the same basic model of Academic, Democratic and Performative events to help better understand and define the culture of this bioregion.
  • Other projects including an anthology of 100 Innovative Cascadia Poets and a free Massive Open Online Course on the history of innovative Cascadia poetry are being planned.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools so that we can ensure the funds get to the poets for this festival.

story:
Hi folks!

My name is Eric Krick, and I'm an aspiring professional illustrator and a student at Savannah College of art and Design.

I'm ready to make that leap between waiting tables and getting professional illustration work, but I don't have the equipment I need to get going. Not having professional equipment of my own has been a detriment to my studies and severely weakens my ability to self-promote. I've tried pretty much everything in my power to get the stuff, but it's been a lot of wheel spinning so far. So, charitable people of indiegogo, I've come to you with some awesome art in exchange for your help! It's sort of like my first solo show!

What a successful campaign would help achieve:

  1. Unfettered access to the technology I need, when I need it
  2. I could finally use my one free Adobe CS6 download furnished by scad, valued at approx. $2500
  3. start my career
  4. build momentum towards a full time career before leaving school
  5. master the programs I use everyday
  6. start saving for my move to NYC next year with illustration income 
  7. begin transitioning out of restaurant work (+5 quality of life points)

Dollars & Cents

  • $1,400 for a 13" Macbook Pro with Retina display

  • $255 for a [Used!] Intuos 4 Medium Tablet

  • $200 for a 1TB external hard drive

  • $30 for a Thunderbolt cable

  • $365 to help cover Indiegogo, Paypal and printing costs

In case we go over our goal, any generous excess would go toward: 

  • Internal hard drive upgrade from 125GB to 250GB

  • Processor upgrade

  • Scanner

  • Camera 

  • Art supplies! 

 

Your contribution will help me begin the professional life which, to this point, I’ve worked toward and dreamed about. Also, it will make my face look like this: 




(What a mug!)

Momentum toward a dream is one of the greatest gifts that one person can give to another. So, THANK YOU, contributors, and thanks for taking the time to read my campaign! And remember, if you like my work, but can't contribute, you can always share!

Perky-weirdly goodness:  (check on the availability of limited perks here: https://www.facebook.com/erickrickart, or in the media gallery!)


 

(A) Walking Seahorse Postcard 

 

(B) Cry Into a Whale 14X17" Poster 

© Art Installations about Love14X14" limited edition matte print 




Some Small Works


Pour Water On a Turtle Original Watercolor  (SOLD {will be releasing another painting shortly!})

Backseat Driver Watercolor Painting



Sketchbook Spread 9X12 Print


My Darling Campaign Helpers:

Elle Grey - Elle is a realist painter currently based out of Chicago. She’s helped with brainstorming, organization and translating my palpable, blood-shuddering enthusiasm into legible text. We took a life drawing class together and have been pals since! http://ellegrey.com/

Karla Castañeda - Karla is a talented illustrator and fellow student here at SCAD. She says funny things and can draw super fast. She is assisting me with perks and general communications. http:// cargocollective.com/karlacastaneda

Cleonique Hilsaca - Another talented illustrator and friend of mine here at SCAD. I met Cleo when she was President of the SCAD illustration club where I would do her bidding. Ahh, sweet role reversal! She's also assisting in general organization, perk fulfillment, and communication. http://cleonique.com/ 



 

 

*Additional note to international contributors:

All perks shipped outside the US will be required to pay $5 extra, and contributors will be responsible for any additional import taxes, duties, etc.

Momentum toward a dream is one of the greatest gifts that one person can give to another. So, THANK YOU, contributors, and thanks for taking the time to read my campaign! And remember, if you like my work, but can't contribute, you can always share!









Perky-weirdly goodness:  (check on the availability of limited perks here: https://www.facebook.com/erickrickart, or in the media gallery!)





 






(A) Walking Seahorse Postcard 




 






(B) Cry Into a Whale 14X17" Poster 










© Art Installations about Love14X14" limited edition matte print 




Some Small Works
Pour Water On a Turtle Original Watercolor  (SOLD {will be releasing another painting shortly!})

Backseat Driver Watercolor Painting

Sketchbook Spread 9X12 Print
My Darling Campaign Helpers:





Elle Grey - Elle is a realist painter currently based out of Chicago. She’s helped with brainstorming, organization and translating my palpable, blood-shuddering enthusiasm into legible text. We took a life drawing class together and have been pals since! http://ellegrey.com/ 
Karla Castañeda - Karla is a talented illustrator and fellow student here at SCAD. She says funny things and can draw super fast. She is assisting me with perks and general communications. http:// cargocollective.com/karlacastaneda 
Cleonique Hilsaca - Another talented illustrator and friend of mine here at SCAD. I met Cleo when she was President of the SCAD illustration club where I would do her bidding. Ahh, sweet role reversal! She's also assisting in general organization, perk fulfillment, and communication. http://cleonique.com/ 




 
 
*Additional note to international contributors:All perks shipped outside the US will be required to pay $5 extra, and contributors will be responsible for any additional import taxes, duties, etc.

story:
Residency 

My name is Aron Fischer...and I am a maker of things.  Currently, I am a MFA Candidate in Sculpture at the University of Missouri, Columbia, with hopes to continue on as a working artist/curator after graduation.  For now, I have been offered an amazing 2 week artist residency opportunity at the Haystack Mountain School of Crafts in Deer Isle, Maine.  

An opportunity like this can not be passed up, but to have this offer extended during my career as a graduate student is not only exciting, but is rather trying and exhausting financially (contrary to popular belief...Grad Students do not live a lavish lifestyle.) Because I would be traveling on a graduate students budget, ticket prices can be overwhelming.  I am asking for some support here.

What that means...

Flights from Columbia, MO to Bangor, ME can run upwards of $700 roundtrip, and since the school is about an hour away from the nearest airport, a taxi/ground transport is the only way to get to the school.  With that said...that is why I am trying to raise $800 to cover these expenses.  I would love to meet and beat that goal, and any money you contribute to this campaign will go to cover my travel expenses to and from Deer Isle, ME.  Anything over that amount will go toward food/materials/living expenses while I am there.

Thanks!

I want to give back to my contributors to show you just how much this experience means to me.  I am an artist/designer that does both additive and subtractive works in paper, clay, metal, wood and basketry based around tools, toys, utensils and items of utility.  You can see some of my works at www.aronfischer.com.  

I have a project that I want to work on while at Haystack - a series of chidrens toys made from wood, ceramic, and basketry dealing with ideas of uncertainty and failures - while exploring some new processes (GLASS BLOWING and METAL SMITHING!) 

All of these ideas are great, but I want to make a few series' of handmade items to say thank you.  Different levels of donations will receive one-of-a-kind pieces made personally for you!  If you have certain requests or allergies (specifically since I work in wood...nut allergies such as walnut, pecan, etc., could be an issue for you) please let me know.  Ill work with you!

 A BIG THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO HAS CONTRIBUTED SO FAR!!!

story:
What is it?

Control Tower is a large scale interactive artwork at Burning Man 2013. It is a complex, challenging and experimental artwork that embodies the ongoing mission of the International Arts Megacrew - to create & support big, collaborative art projects that promote the creative development & self expression of people from all walks of life.

Control Tower will be a 60' tall interactive platform to which we invite any and all artists to contribute. Every aspect of the tower will be interactive, from the never before seen experimental flame effects, to the massive & dazzling array of RGB lasers, to the shifting patterns that play across the entire surface of the artwork.

Why?

Burning Man is growing rapidly into a global force for good, and our principles are spreading ever further into the world. This project will provide a platform for massive international collaboration and participation, allowing artists and burners from all over the world to contribute content and ideas to the final work - a true celebration of our increasingly international and networked community! 

At Burning Man, the Temple embodies the past, our memories, and our internal lives. The Man himself embodies immediacy, the now, and shared experience in the present moment. 

We hope the Tower will express our hope for the future, the coming age of international and interregional collaboration, and be a testbed for technologies and techniques that let burners everywhere interact with each other on a gloabl scale.

Who's responsible for this madness?

The project is being led by IAM, a crew with two pretty epic large scale Burning Man artworks under their belt, Megatropolis 2010, and the Temple of Transition 2011. 

IAM is a crew of artists, engineers and volunteers from 22 countries around the world that assemble in Reno, Nevada every summer to build some of the largest and most collaborative work at Burning Man. 

Once again, we hope to engage hundreds, maybe even thousands of people in a wildly co-creative experiment to see just how far we can take the Burning Man principles of participation, inclusion, and collaboration.

This year, we are not alone in our efforts, and are being rapidly joined by a wide array of highly skilled collaborators, including:

UV99 - the Opulent Temple laser crew

Mischief Lab - purveyors of fine experimental flame effects

BambooDNA - creators of the Starry Bamboo Mandala

AudioPixel - LED programming @ NEXUS, Tipper, and Temple of Boom

Media Architecture Institute - Outdoor LED installations worldwde

The Ein Hammer Crew - Interaction programming & nonsense

Would you and your crew like to get involved? Just let us know! This project is rapidly shaping up to be one of those legendary collaborations only possible at Burning Man, so the more the merrier, IMHO!!

Why do we need your support?

For various reasons, including their belief in our ability to raise the required funding ourselves, we did not get an art grant from Burning Man, although they have agreed to support us in all kinds of other, softer ways. 

This project is a LOT smaller than the Temple, but due to its complexity and mind-bending awesomeness, it's still gonna cost a significant amount to bring to fruition - about $50,000. We think we can raise about half of that figure via fundraising events, but these events can only be attended by people in Reno and the Bay - so we are here on Indiegogo to ask you guys, the Burning Man community, to help us raise the other half. 

You have trusted us and supported us in 2010 and 2011, and if you choose to fund us again, we promise to deliver you another epic, thought provoking, interactive and fundamentally FUN project for you to experience and play with in the sweet, dusty desert this summer at Burning Man 2013. 

Donations are Tax Deductible!

In return for your support, we have a range of of juicy schwag for you to choose from as a thank you for your kind donation - but wait, there's more!

Thanks to our Fiscal Sponsor Fractured Atlas, we are delighted to announce that all donations to the project are Tax Deductible to the extent permitted by law. We will be delighted to work with you to ensure you receive a Tax receipt in exchange for your kind donation. 

Please support the project in other ways.

Even if you can't make a donation, there are other ways to get involved in helping to bring this transplendant artwork to glorious, shining, flame shooting life!

Share this campaign with your friends, pages, groups and family! 

Like our facebook page

Check out our website: www.control-tower.net

Volunteer & Collaborate - please like our facebook page for updates on how to get involved.

 

THANK YOU, AND SEE YOU IN THE DUST!!!

story:
#SingleMomDefined creates an ACCURATE definition of single black motherhood. Often, when single Black mothers are discussed, we are crammed into the same storyline when in fact we each took different paths to parenthood. Some women ended relationships, exited abusive environments, divorced or were widowed or abandoned. I was dumped over the phone by my long-term boyfriend during my second trimester! But rarely in mainstream media are these women credited for making rational decisions or forming successful co-parenting relationships . Instead, they are sometimes told they won’t be able to raise happy, healthy children on their own. This is a myth! The single Black moms I know are more than amazing, I want to introduce them to the world and change Google's search results. 

Your donations will help us tell the stories of more moms in more neighborhoods. Plus, it will support the online and in person single moms group, including writing workshops and self-care sessions. The Heinz Endowments and The Pittsburgh Foundation are supporting this effort. You help us expand it!

So why should you care? We must change the negative narrative around single black moms, which results in cultural bias and micro-aggressions. Although I'll illustrate amazing, successful moms (some raising kids with their exes, like me) the project will also raise awareness about the larger political, social, legal and economic forces that have contributed to single parent households, many of which are impoverished. It's time for our community to love one another instead of seeking to divide. It's time to recognize the many black men who are active and present. Thank you in advance for helping to change the negative narrative and encourage people to love instead of judge.
