story:
Who We Are

Fashion Alliance World, South Florida Inc. is created to bring together fashion designers, fashion stylist, merchandisers, artists, illustrators, photographers, models, hair/make-up to join forces in promoting the growth of the fashion/art industry in South Florida, and to showcase the work of Fashion Alliance’s members in “The Art Row”. Fashion Alliance World, South Florida will be actively involved in supporting and providing exposure for new and upcoming designers and artists, through our shows, workshops, local boutiques and also national and international marketing promotions. A variety of programs and events will be prepared to generate interest in the industry and to attract national and international interest in South Florida fashion/art designers. Throughout the year, Fashion Alliance will present different fashion/art events. Some events will be for members in the industry only, and others will be geared towards retail buyers to heighten their knowledge of the fashion/art industry.

About This Project

Fashion Alliance World (FAW) is the proud host of “As the Sun Rises over Fort Lauderdale”, a festival of fashion and art. This year’s event will be held here in Fort Lauderdale, Broward County with fashion designers and artists from countries around the world to come into Fort Lauderdale to present their collections and celebrate with us. FAW (Designers?) will present their exclusive and exquisite collections, which will without a doubt, be some of the most stylish and welcoming designs from different cultures around the world. FAW will judiciously select three designers and artists whose work has impressed the fashion and art world and whose vision can be interpreted into an affordable collection resulting in a wide-ranging offer of exclusive high quality fashion, art and accessories. This festival is open to everyone in the art industry whether they are fashion illustrators, visual artists, performing artists, photographers, and graphic artists among others to display their work. Buyers from around the world will be invited to attend this event. Proceeds raised from this event will benefit two non-profit organizations that are involved with special needs children, as well as part of the proceeds will go to provide a place for designers, and artist called “The Art Row.” The Art Row will help to provide visibility for all our members. “As The Sun Rises Over Fort Lauderdale” will be a milestone for Broward County’s fashion/art industries, therefore, let us celebrate this milestone in style with the presentation of this fashion/art extravaganza.  Since fashion is the obsession of this modern world, fashion cannot be more stylish without our young designers, and their contributions from different cultures. This event will also involve artist in all areas of art, whether visual art or performing arts. This is also an invitation for everyone to come and discover the fashion, art and the culture of this great city and beyond - Fort Lauderdale, known as the Venice of America.

How You Can Help

If you can't support this project, here is how you can help. Donate your frequent flyer miles by placing this project on your Facebook, Instagram, & Twitter, Google+, Pinterest, LinkedIn & etc. to all your social media contacts, and ask your friends to do the same. Please spread the word! Pass it on, show your passion for our young and up-coming fashion designers and artists of today and tomorrow; let’s go, let’s do it!  We want you to keep watching Indiegogo for forum updates. Again we cannot do it without you, therefore, please shout this out to your family, friends and neighbors, here, there, everywhere, because spreading the word will be a openhanded help to this project. Thank you all, and thank you INDIEGOGO!

Rewards for Backers

Every backer will be credited on FAW’s website and all Non Profit partners’ websites. We have rewards for you our supporters; FAW is hoping that you will support and attend this event and give us a chance to meet you. Please let us be aware of you presence and our team will be sure to welcome you. Some reward such as the DVDs won’t be ready in a week after the event, as we have to have it edited and copied. However, we are asking you to watch our website for updates such as for mailing or shipping dates and do not forget to keep up with Indiegogo.

Contest

We mentioned before that there will be surprises coming. Now, (1) If you are able to bring support to this project, you will have VIP tickets for two to dine with the stars or a designer will dress you for this occasion.  (2) There will a weekend in Jamaica (3) a 7 day cruise. COME ON BOARD AND WIN YOUR PRIZE!

Spread The Love

We think everyone would love this fundraiser project! We would be so grateful if you would share our campaign with your friends and family.

Contest

Now, (1) If you are able to bring support to this project, you will have VIP tickets for two to dine with the stars or a designer will dress you for this occasion.  (2) There will a weekend in Jamaica (3) a 7 day cruise. COME ON BOARD AND WIN YOUR PRIZE!



Spread The Love

story:
The Snowflake Assassins

We are a band of friends who are crazy enough to brave the snow, wind and ice for three and a half days -- in January . We are Chris Wing (team captain), Kelly Madison and Candace Washburn. The three of us make up the team "The Snowflake Assassins". 

Chris studied graphic design with a concentration in illustration at Watkin's College of Art and Design in Nashville. He lived there for six years focusing on 2-D and 3-D work. He moved to Rockford, IL before moving to Chicago in 2011 where he currently resides. He has competed in the Illinois snow sculpting competition two times, with this upcoming year being his third. He loves pixel art, barcades and hanging out with his zoo of animals.

Kelly Madison studied fine art with a concentration in screen printing at Rockford University in Rockford. After finishing college, she moved to Japan to participate in the JET program for several years to teach English. While abroad, she was able to fine tune her style and incorporate East-Asian influences that can be found in her work today. She has competed in the Illinois snow sculpting competition four times, with this upcoming year being her fifth. 

Candace Washburn studied music at University of North Texas in Denton. She dabbles in many forms of art, especially illustration and painting. She's lead singer of LePercolateur, an amazing gypsy jazz band in Chicago, IL. This will be her first year taking on the large block of snow.

What's The Sculpture?

We have to have a sculpture, right? We are doing a sculpture that focuses on everyone's favorite book and TV series: Game of Thrones! This will be carved into a 10'x6'x6' solid block of snow and ice. Depicting a ferocious direwolf, representative of the ancient and proud House Stark, and lion, symbolic of the wealth and pride of House Lannister, the sculpture will capture a flurry of teeth, claws, and fur.

What We Need & What You Get

We have some basic tools but we are looking to purchase or rent some specialized tools. 

We need:

  • (3) Root cutters
  • (1) Scaffolding 
  • (1) Barbwire
  • (1) 12ft Ladder
  • (1) Two-man saw
  • (3) Portable work-lights (We only  had one last year and that made night time carving very interesting.)
  • All the hothands (These things save lives.When I say lives, I mean fingers.)
  • (3) Axes
  • (3) Water-proof gloves
What you get:
  • Digital personal thank you with a $5 donation
  • Access to team play list with plus previous perk with a $10 donation
  • Snail Mail Postcard plus previous perks with a $15 donation
  • Limited Edition Print plus previous perks with a $20 donation
  • Custom Drawing from one of the team members plus previous perks (excluding limit edition print) with a $40 donation.
  • Drawings & Team Sticker from all three members plus previous perks (excluding limited edition print and single drawing) with a $50 donation.
  • Our unconditional love with a $100 donation. This includes all previous perks and the limited edition print. 

Risks & Challenges

This will be a challenge without most of the items we have listed above. The sculpture is still doable but it will not be as detailed without. Items like root cutters allows us to remove large amounts of snow in a short amount of time. 

Time is crucial during this competition. We are allowed to work Wednesday 8:00 AM - 11:00 PM, Thursday 8:00 AM - 11:00 PM and Friday 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM Saturday Morning. 

With your help it will reduce any stress we might have about time and allow us to really work on the details. 

If Your Wallet Can't Help, You Still Can

We understand you may not be able to contribute with the holiday season approaching. What you can do is post this everywhere. We want your mom to know how awesome our sculpture will be. 

If you have any of the tools listed and are willing to lend them to us, you can contact Chris at c.wing87@gmail.com. We promise to take good care of any equipment provided. 

We look forward to seeing you on January 17th at Sinnissippi Park so that you can participating in voting for your favorite sculpture!

Candace Washburn studied music at University of North Texas in Denton. She dabbles in many forms of art, especially illustration and painting. She's lead singer of LePercolateur, an amazing gypsy jazz band in Chicago, IL. This will be her first year taking on the large block of snow.

We have to have a sculpture, right? We are doing a sculpture that focuses on everyone's favorite book and TV series: Game of Thrones! This will be carved into a 10'x6'x6' solid block of snow and ice. Depicting a ferocious direwolf, representative of the ancient and proud House Stark, and lion, symbolic of the wealth and pride of House Lannister, the sculpture will capture a flurry of teeth, claws, and fur.
   What We Need & What You Get We have some basic tools but we are looking to purchase or rent some specialized tools. 
We need:  (3) Root cutters (1) Scaffolding  (1) Barbwire
(1) 12ft Ladder
(1) Two-man saw
(3) Portable work-lights (We only  had one last year and that made night time carving very interesting.)
All the hothands (These things save lives.When I say lives, I mean fingers.)
(3) Axes
(3) Water-proof gloves 
What you get:

Digital personal thank you with a $5 donation

Access to team play list with plus previous perk with a $10 donation

Snail Mail Postcard plus previous perks with a $15 donation

Limited Edition Print plus previous perks with a $20 donation

Custom Drawing from one of the team members plus previous perks (excluding limit edition print) with a $40 donation.

Drawings & Team Sticker from all three members plus previous perks (excluding limited edition print and single drawing) with a $50 donation.

Our unconditional love with a $100 donation. This includes all previous perks and the limited edition print. 


    Risks & Challenges This will be a challenge without most of the items we have listed above. The sculpture is still doable but it will not be as detailed without. Items like root cutters allows us to remove large amounts of snow in a short amount of time. 
Time is crucial during this competition. We are allowed to work Wednesday 8:00 AM - 11:00 PM, Thursday 8:00 AM - 11:00 PM and Friday 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM Saturday Morning. 
With your help it will reduce any stress we might have about time and allow us to really work on the details. 
    If Your Wallet Can't Help, You Still Can We understand you may not be able to contribute with the holiday season approaching. What you can do is post this everywhere. We want your mom to know how awesome our sculpture will be. 
If you have any of the tools listed and are willing to lend them to us, you can contact Chris at c.wing87@gmail.com. We promise to take good care of any equipment provided. 
We look forward to seeing you on January 17th at Sinnissippi Park so that you can participating in voting for your favorite sculpture!

story:
UPDATE:

The campaign has been relaunched on Kickstarter!

http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1134016110/...

Nine from Nine

Nine from Nine will be an illustrated book of a Viking Age poem. It's a visual account of the Norse god Odin’s eighteen magical songs.

Nine from Nine will be a beautiful book that presents the rich subject matter in a clean and accessible way.

 

Where Does the Poem Come From?

There are two Icelandic manuscripts that contain the oldest written records of Norse mythology. They are called the Younger and Elder Eddas. The poem is called Ljóðatal and is a small section of the Elder Edda.

The stories, verses and sayings contained within the Eddas are an incredible source of information about the lives and beliefs of the Vikings.

For an illustrator, nine worlds inhabitated by gods, giants and trolls is just too exciting to pass up!

 

Book Specs

The book will be Hardback. Approximately 17cm x 20cm (6.5" x 8") and 40 pages (80 sides). Each verse of the poem will have 1 to 3 full-page illustrations. There will be a section at the end of the book explaining each verse and some information about it's illustration.

 

Breakdown of the Poem

The father of the gods, Odin is obsessed with acquiring arcane knowledge. So much so that he has previously given up one of his eyes in exchange for a chance to make use of Mimir’s well of knowledge.

At the start of this poem, we meet the now one-eyed Odin hanging on the world tree, Yggdrasill.

Odin stabs himself with his spear, sacrificing himself to himself. Now dead and in the underworld he aquires knowledge of nine songs (these are like charms or spells) from a big, scary giant.

Odin is then re-born, wiser and inspired. He is able to create a new song from each of the nine taught to him. A stanza (verse) is then dedicated to a desciption of the powerful magical effects of each song.

 

Ljóðatal Translation

You've probably already noticed that whenever possible I've used the original Old Norse words. Sometimes it's good to mix things up. I'm attempting to make something incredibly old more accessible but I don't want to change the original ideas or the translation unless I really have to. This will hopefully produce a much richer experience for the reader.

I have based my text on an out of copyright translation by Benjamin Thorpe. This translation is one of the more faithful to the original structure and wording of the poem.

 

 

Visual Language of the Book

When designers use type they often use a grid to space out the text so that each heading and paragraph has a visual relationship. This grid will often relate to the size of the page so that all the elements lock together.

These illustrations are placed on one of these grids but they are also drawn in relation to the grid. It's all part of a contemporary visual debate about how painting meets graphics, especially when using a computer to produce work.

The book features cool stuff like trolls and giants though, so let's not worry about that too much.

The colours are chosen to describe specific settings and also the cold muggy light of Iceland. I'm obsessed with colour so i'll be spending way too much time on that.

Red is used for blood and to signify a link to Niflheim, the land of the dead. If someone has red eyes they really are actually dead. Scary stuff.

 

Naughty Bits and Zombie Vikings

The illustrations will depict some nudity and violence, as befits the subject matter. Also included: trolls, giants, eight-legged horses and zombie Vikings.

Why Indiegogo?

I've been working on this project for over a year now. I've been sketching on the train journey into work and then working up these drawings on a computer at home at the weekends.

Working in this way, the project would take another year to finish. The ambition of this campaign is to get a completed book out there much sooner than this.

 

The Goal

If I Achieve the Goal

The book will be produced within approximately 3 months from the end of the campaign, depending on printing times. The wallpapers and prints as soon as possible after the campaign ends. Exciting!

 

If I Don't Achieve the Goal

The book will take much longer to produce as I fit it in around work, approximately a year from now! The wallpapers and prints much sooner.

If you'd like to get involved, please use PayPal (if possible, if not, don't worry) as this isn't delayed until the end of the campaign.

Me and You, You and Me

My name's Guy. I'm a freelance designer with 20 years experience in design, illustration, web and print. I have a soft spot for tea and biscuits.

Thanks for taking the time to check out the campaign. If you like the work it'd be great if you could spread the word- tweet it, follow it, like it! Go on, you know you want to.

If you have any questions, ask away.

 

The Perks

 

Turnip £5

  • A wallpaper pack based on an artwork from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.

 

Zombie Viking £10

  • A wallpaper pack based on 3 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.

 

Troll £15

  • A wallpaper pack based on 3 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.

 

Viking £40 (Book Option)

  • A wallpaper pack based on 3 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • The hardback book of Nine from Nine!
  • A set of 4 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.

 

Viking £40 (Print Option)

For those that would prefer a print to the book or would like to add a print.

  • A wallpaper pack based on 3 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • A set of 4 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • A signed, high quality, limited edition A3 Giclee print featuring artwork from Nine from Nine.

 

Giant £100

  • A wallpaper pack based on 6 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • The hardback book of Nine from Nine!
  • A set of 6 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • You will have your name printed within the book thanking you for your amazing contribution. Your name will stay in any future editions of the book.

 

Norse God £150

  • A wallpaper pack based on 6 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • A signed copy of the hardback book of Nine from Nine!
  • A set of 6 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • You will have your name and Norse God status printed within the book thanking you for your amazing contribution. Your name will stay in any future editions of the book.
  • A signed, high quality, limited edition A3 Giclee print featuring artwork from Nine from Nine.

 

Odin £300

  • A wallpaper pack based on 6 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • A signed copy of the hardback book of Nine from Nine!
  • A set of 6 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • You will have your name and Odin status printed within the book thanking you for your amazing contribution. Your name will stay in any future editions of the book.
  • A signed, high quality, limited edition A3 Giclee print featuring artwork from Nine from Nine.
  • 2 extra copies of Nine from Nine or 2 different A3 Giclee prints featuring artwork from the book. Your choice!

 

Sponsor £500 (Option 1)

  • A wallpaper pack based on 6 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • A signed copy of the hardback book of Nine from Nine! (Special, sponsors boxed edition).
  • A set of 6 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • You will have your name and Sponsor status printed within the book thanking you for your amazing contribution. Your name will stay in any future editions of the book.
  • A signed, high quality, limited edition A3 Giclee print featuring artwork from Nine from Nine.
  • 2 extra copies of Nine from Nine or 2 different A3 Giclee prints featuring artwork from the book. Your choice!
  • Your name or logo prominently displayed as a sponsor.
  • Nine from Nine t-shirt.
  • A Nine from Nine themed birthday card for the next nine years!*

 

Sponsor £500 (Option 2)

  • A wallpaper pack based on 6 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • A signed copy of the hardback book of Nine from Nine! (Special, sponsors boxed edition).
  • A set of 6 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • You will have your name and Sponsor status printed within the book thanking you for your amazing contribution. Your name will stay in any future editions of the book.
  • A signed, high quality, limited edition A3 Giclee print featuring artwork from Nine from Nine.
  • A signed, high quality, limited edition HUGE (762 x 1524mm / 30 x 60") panoramic Giclee print featuring new artwork: Ragnarok. This artwork will only be produced if someone goes for this perk. This is the final battle between the gods featuring Odin getting chomped by the giant wolf Fenrir, Thor fighting a giant serpent and other epic goodness.
  • Your name or logo prominently displayed as a sponsor.
  • Nine from Nine t-shirt.
  • A Nine from Nine themed birthday card for the next nine years!*

 

Sponsor £500 (Option 3)

  • A wallpaper pack based on 6 artworks from the book for desktop, iPad and iPhone. If you'd like a different size let me know.
  • A copy of Nine from Nine in ebook format.
  • A signed copy of the hardback book of Nine from Nine! (Special, sponsors boxed edition).
  • A set of 6 bookmarks featuring artwork from the book.
  • You will have your name and Sponsor status printed within the book thanking you for your amazing contribution. Your name will stay in any future editions of the book.
  • 18 signed, high quality Giclee prints based on each on the 18 songs! 18! ( 203 x 254mm / 8 x 10")
  • Your name or logo prominently displayed as a sponsor.
  • Nine from Nine t-shirt.
  • A Nine from Nine themed birthday card for the next nine years!*

 

*unless my fingers fall off or I get eaten by zombies or something :-)

 

 

Updates

Check the update tab near the top of the page for ongoing announcements.

 

Thanks for checking out the campaign!

story:
Hello! My name is Ian Nicely, and I have been obsessed with glass art for the past 4 years. Over a year ago I realized that my own dream of creating beautiful art out of borosilicte glass was attainable and I began working towards it while also attending university. While in school I took an entry level class in lampworking and completely fell in love with it. I began renting space in that studio and practicing on my own to further my skills and work towards achieving my vision. Unfortuantely the rent at that studio was more than I could afford at the time, and I had to leave and save until I could purchase my own torch and kiln.

I am now trying to build my own studio space in my basement where I can work year round, at any time, and rent free. The major startup costs in a lampworking studio are the kiln, the torch, and the work bench which I already possess. What I now need is a ventilation system to remove the harmful exhaust and fumes produced by the torch, oxygen and propane tanks to fuel the torch, raw glass, and shelving and storage for glass and tools.

If met my goal of $600 will be used as follows: (if not met then it will be used to purchase as much as I can in the order it appears)

 

1. Gable mounted attic fan 1650 CFM $100

2. Rent and fill an oxygen K tank $150

3. buy a full propane tank $30

5. buy raw glass to work with $120

4. Buy tool racks and rolling work stations $200

If I recieve funding beyond my goal the excess will go towards more raw glass and to refill my gas as it runs out.

story:
My name is Kyle Heinly otherwise known in the art scene as Twitch Thomason. I am a proud handicapable artist born with spastic quadriplegic cerebral palsy along with global epilepsy, who paints in an abstract primitive street art technique (I call it), and am inspired by philosophy, poetry, and spirituality/life. I met, was influenced to start painting after years of writing poetry by Jeff Filipski who I see as a kindred spirit, and a mentor in many ways. Since our first meeting, learning of what art could do/has done in my life I know this what I want to do for the rest of mine. With your help I would seek to experiment, and further my own/all artistic boundaries by going to Art Basil.

We appreciate any contribution towards our goal.

 

Thank you,

 

Twitch Thomason aka Kyle Heinly

Jeff Filipski

story:
"Quercus"

Quercus (latin for oak)- and the title of my upcoming solo art show at Jamestown Community College's Center Gallery in Olean NY.  Opening February 21st 2014 (tentative date)- the show will be a scientific, historical, personal, and most importantly artistic exploration of the White Oak tree which towers over my childhood home. 

  The show will consist of at least the following:

*A painting based on the tree core, I plan on using an incremental boring tool to drill into the tree (don't worry, it doesn't harm the tree) which will tell me the growth patterns and and age of the tree.  The piece will describe how history (including my own life) and the environment intersect- this tree is hundreds of years old, think of what has happened since It was a seedling!

*Accompanying Hand Bound Book describing what is going on in the tree core painting

*Paintings based on the leaf structures- I'm using a microscope to to look at the leaves in detail and then base paintings on my observations- think small picture

*Large Scale Tree Portrait- think big picture

*works based on the lichens and fungi growing on the tree

*tree castings (depends on if I get enough funding before the weather turns!)  I want to make moulds of the trunk of the tree and then cast them -imagine eight foot pillars showing every nook and cranny in the bark

The goal is to push my own boundaries in an interdisciplinary way.  My nine to five job has become art, mainly selling my work at festivals.  While this has been my dream, and it's frankly amazing, I find myself wanting to explore my ideas without the constraints of having to make something that will "sell". This show will also let me revisit a fondly remembered aspect of my not always ideal childhood, -my giant tree! (I cried harder leaving the tree behind when my parents divorced than for my dog) and incorporate these memories and how my own history intersect with the tree.

To get these ideas off the ground I need money, not an obscene amount but more than I can swing by myself currently.  Please help me out, I promise you'll love the results!

Hey I need stuff, but I'll give you stuff!

Those of you who know me well, know that I'm a bit of a nature nerd.  With Quercus, the plan is to run with this!  To geek out to the next level I need some stuff... 

What your donation supplies:

* An incremental borer- ooooo sounds sexy doesn't it?  This tool, which is made in Sweden and runs about $1000!!!!!! will let me drill a pencil width core into the tree (without harming the tree) and let me see the growth patterns and history of the tree (and how they intersect with my own life and the life of my family)

*a microscope -the plan is to do paintings based on microscopic views of the leaves, bark, lichen etc on the tree

*casting materials- I want to do castings of the trunk -this stuff is expensive!

*acrylic paints and the stuff that goes with them

*oil paints and all the stuff that goes with - this means news brushes, solvents, and a lot of random odds and ends

*general art materials- there's a reason why art is expensive, and a lot of it is just supplies, this will pay for everything from my $200 rolls of watercolor paper to paper towels 

*stuff that I haven't even realized I need yet

However I'm not just begging for hand-outs, you'll get stuff too!  Each level of donation gives you something- from a thank you and mention on the donor list, to original artwork based on the show.

I can't do this without help!

Having a show at the weeks is an amazing and rare opportunity for me, without financial help I won't be able to do it.  A lot of the ideas for the show have been percolating in my brain for years now, and it's time to let them out! 

I'm also hoping this show also becomes the stepping stone to the next level in my career.  When finished I hope to market it as a whole to various regional (national?) galleries and institutions.

 Hey I understand if you can't contribute, times are tough, but here are other ways you can help...

  Can't donate, I totally understand, but you can help me get the word out.  Sharing this campaign on facebook, talking about it to friends, and even an email or ten can go a long way towards making this successful. 

THANK YOU!!!!!  Just taking the time to read this thing means a lot to me,

Sean
story_txt: "Quercus"Quercus (latin for oak)- and the title of my upcoming solo art show at Jamestown Community College's Center Gallery in Olean NY.  Opening February 21st 2014 (tentative date)- the show will be a scientific, historical, personal, and most importantly artistic exploration of the White Oak tree which towers over my childhood home.   The show will consist of at least the following:*A painting based on the tree core, I plan on using an incremental boring tool to drill into the tree (don't worry, it doesn't harm the tree) which will tell me the growth patterns and and age of the tree.  The piece will describe how history (including my own life) and the environment intersect- this tree is hundreds of years old, think of what has happened since It was a seedling!*Accompanying Hand Bound Book describing what is going on in the tree core painting*Paintings based on the leaf structures- I'm using a microscope to to look at the leaves in detail and then base paintings on my observations- think small picture*Large Scale Tree Portrait- think big picture*works based on the lichens and fungi growing on the tree*tree castings (depends on if I get enough funding before the weather turns!)  I want to make moulds of the trunk of the tree and then cast them -imagine eight foot pillars showing every nook and cranny in the barkThe goal is to push my own boundaries in an interdisciplinary way.  My nine to five job has become art, mainly selling my work at festivals.  While this has been my dream, and it's frankly amazing, I find myself wanting to explore my ideas without the constraints of having to make something that will "sell". This show will also let me revisit a fondly remembered aspect of my not always ideal childhood, -my giant tree! (I cried harder leaving the tree behind when my parents divorced than for my dog) and incorporate these memories and how my own history intersect with the tree.To get these ideas off the ground I need money, not an obscene amount but more than I can swing by myself currently.  Please help me out, I promise you'll love the results!Hey I need stuff, but I'll give you stuff!Those of you who know me well, know that I'm a bit of a nature nerd.  With Quercus, the plan is to run with this!  To geek out to the next level I need some stuff... What your donation supplies:* An incremental borer- ooooo sounds sexy doesn't it?  This tool, which is made in Sweden and runs about $1000!!!!!! will let me drill a pencil width core into the tree (without harming the tree) and let me see the growth patterns and history of the tree (and how they intersect with my own life and the life of my family)*a microscope -the plan is to do paintings based on microscopic views of the leaves, bark, lichen etc on the tree*casting materials- I want to do castings of the trunk -this stuff is expensive!*acrylic paints and the stuff that goes with them*oil paints and all the stuff that goes with - this means news brushes, solvents, and a lot of random odds and ends*general art materials- there's a reason why art is expensive, and a lot of it is just supplies, this will pay for everything from my $200 rolls of watercolor paper to paper towels *stuff that I haven't even realized I need yetHowever I'm not just begging for hand-outs, you'll get stuff too!  Each level of donation gives you something- from a thank you and mention on the donor list, to original artwork based on the show.I can't do this without help!Having a show at the weeks is an amazing and rare opportunity for me, without financial help I won't be able to do it.  A lot of the ideas for the show have been percolating in my brain for years now, and it's time to let them out! I'm also hoping this show also becomes the stepping stone to the next level in my career.  When finished I hope to market it as a whole to various regional (national?) galleries and institutions. Hey I understand if you can't contribute, times are tough, but here are other ways you can help...  Can't donate, I totally understand, but you can help me get the word out.  Sharing this campaign on facebook, talking about it to friends, and even an email or ten can go a long way towards making this successful. THANK YOU!!!!!  Just taking the time to read this thing means a lot to me,Sean

story:
After years of running separate art establishments (THE CLAASSEN GALLERY & SAN LUIS ART SUPPLY) and hosting a slew of SLO's most attended and memorable art shows (URBAN ESCAPADES, PASCAL’S PEEPS, 100&UNDER, LAST FRIDAY, ART AFTER ART AFTER DARK @ SLOMA), Neal and Jeff have decided to team up and combine their efforts. Their new SLO County art endeavor is called "Fiasco Gallery" and is located at Studios on the Park in Paso Robles CA. 

We officially set up shop at the beginning of August and have been pleasantly surprised with all this town has to offer as well as all the people that support the arts. To make this "Fiasco" adventure continue we need your help. The studio/gallery space and other additional fees amount to about $1300 per month. We would really like to stay in this space as long as possible. Realistically, to keep Fiasco Gallery going through the new year would take closer to $5,000 (rent and other fees associated with being members of Studios On The Park). Although we need a lot more than what we're asking for, we will be super stoked and overly grateful to receive anything and we will put any and all funds to good use in an effort to make Fiasco a place worth visiting where you can check out cool artwork, meet and watch us at work, and leave feeling inspired.

Like we mentioned above, we've been in the studio since August, but still feel like newbies in Paso Robles and have no idea what we're in for in the coming months. Will the folks in Paso Robles support our artwork as much as our fans and collectors we've gained in SLO?   We've come to Indiegogo in an effort to keep the ball rolling by selling Fiasco t-shirts, super fancy one of kind collaboration pieces and also some limited edition prints. Venturing into the unknown is exciting, but not without a little fear. With your support we can dive in head first with confidence.

Our fancy pants art bios can be seen if you scroll down, but for now here are some photos of our latest collaboration pieces.

REWARDS
Please keep in mind when checking out our rewards that all of our art sales go right back into making more art and keeping our studio open. With that said, if you're into what we're doing and want to help support us but are not totally sold on the rewards we're offering you can still help us out by sharing our project with your family and friends by posting a link on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Pinterest, Instagram (@fiascogallery, #fiascogallery) etc. You can also venture over to our online shops and purchase work there.

Jeff has TONS of artsy items available at www.etsy.com/shop/jeffclaassen.
He also has a plethora of licensed merchandise like cell phone covers and throw pillows available at www.society6.com/JeffClaassen.
Neal is currently involved in a lot of art shows in San Luis Obispo (because he's a rockstar). You can purchase his original paintings at the following venues:
- Steynberg Gallery: show ends October 26, 2013
- Linnaeas Cafe: show runs October 5 - 25, 2013
- Faces A La Mode - show ends November 22, 2013
He is also in the process of getting his online shop up and running with limited edition prints and art supplies at squareup.com/market/neal-breton.

Ok, now on to the super awesome goodies available right here on the one and only Indiegogo!

Official Fiasco Gallery T-Shirt


We consider this shirt to be our main reward because who doesn't like rockin' an awesome t-shirt, especially when it's got our handsome faces on it. It's a no brainer, people. These will be American Apparel Unisex "cotton/poly" shirts, so that they are super duper soft and won't shrink too much. And, of course, Made in the good ole' U.S of A.

Screen printed tees are super cool, but every t-shirt printer I've ever met has a minimum number of shirts they need to print to make it worth their while. If minimums aren't met they would go out of business. The minimum is what makes it difficult for artists and designers to get shirts printed. The t-shirt printer we use has a 36 piece minimum, so it would be SUPER COOL if enough of you (36 to be exact) purchase a shirt so that we meet the shirt printers minimum.

This will be a one color (white ink) print on a black tee. It will be available in unisex sizing for Men and Women (size xs, s, m, l, xl, 2xl). Women may prefer to order one size smaller. Once this campaign ends we will post an update with specific sizing information so you know what size will be best for you.

Collaboration Art By Jeff And Neal
These examples are all one of a kind originals and available as individual rewards. If you choose a collaboration reward it will be a total surprise, but these will give you an example of what to expect. 






Limited Edition Prints by Neal Breton





Owl Paintings by Jeff Claassen


Limited Edition Prints by Jeff Claassen



Collaboration Sketchbook

Jeff is super excited about this reward and Neal agreed to offer it against his better judgement, but if you are the lucky person that chooses this you will really be in for a treat. Sketchbooks are awesome and are essentially the "behind the scenes" you never get to witness. The book pictured above is Neal's sketchbook that is used and abused, which makes it all the more awesome. For this reward Jeff and Neal will use a 104 page 5" x 8.25" Moleskin hardcover sketchbook. It will be filled cover to cover with artsy goodness. It will be a fun mix of collaboration work as well as solo artist pages. Filling a sketchbook cover to cover can be a huge undertaking so you may not receive this until the beginning of March 2014, but it will be super awesome, totally one of kind and well worth the wait. 



Fiasco Bottle Opener Keychains


Neal's Bio

Neal Breton, a New Hampshire native, has been a professional artist for twenty years. He studied painting at Pasadena City College. His artistic endeavors in the Los Angeles area lasted over 15 years, in which he showed and sold a large body of work all over Southern California.

Breton moved to the Central Coast in 2008 years ago, where he continued to showcase his work at galleries and cafes. He began a stint as a business owner in 2009, opening up San Luis Art Supply, which became known not only as a place to buy supplies affordably, but as a hub of activity amongst the young and underground art scene. Breton sold the shop in 2012 to pursue other endeavors as a painter and curator.

As an illustrator for the SLO New Times, his work has won awards in 2011 and 2012 from CNPA (California Newspaper Publisher Awards) and AAN (Association of Alternative Newsweeklies). 

Neal has also organized and curated several successful shows around the Central Coast over the past few years, including the “Young Savages” emerging artist event at Studios on the Park.

More Neal shenanigans at www.nealbreton.com

Jeff's Bio


Jeff lives on a strict diet of cereal and Thai iced tea with an occasional chocolate donut. Despite his poor dietary choices he has been pumping out colorfully bold paintings since before you had an email address and carried a phone in your pocket. His obsessive painting efforts have earned him the title "Best Artist In SLO County" by SLO New TImes Readers for 2010-2013. These accolades haven't gotten to his head or inflated his ego. Just kidding, he totally thinks he's a rockstar. When not painting or making digital doodles on the iPad he can be found walking around town with his family taking way too many photos with his iphone, riding his watermelon colored bicycle, or laying on his couch reading a book when he should be doing house chores like replacing the leaky skylight.

More Jeff shenanigans at www.jeffclaassen.com

And of course, Fiasco has shenanigans happening too. Find and follow us on:
Instagram: @fiascogallery
Facebook: www.facebook.com/fiascogallery

If you have any questions or concerns please do not hesitate to contact us. We will answer all your questions as fast as we can.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project.
- Jeff & Neal

story:
My Hero... My Father...

Hi.  My name is Gene DeCicco, and for as long as I can remember I have been an artist.   I'll share with you when I knew what I wanted to be...

    

      When I was a young boy, around 10, my Father (who worked in a factory since he was out of high school) told me he wanted to show me something. We had never talked about art, or drawing or anything cultural. My Dad was practical, and never spoke of art or anything having to do with it.  He dug through a closet and found an old manilla envelope.  He opened it up and displayed a stack of drawings of comic book covers from the 1940's that he had copied when he was a teenager growing up in Brooklyn, after the great depression. The drawings were beautiful.  He did them all in pencil and colored pencil.  I was amazed and shocked as he flipped through the art, and he said, "I wanted you to know that I used to draw too..."  As tears filled my eyes, my heart raced and at that point I knew what I wanted to do with my life...

Sadly those drawings were lost due to Hurricane Sandy... But they changed the course of my life...

                

I am grateful for my family, my health and the support I have... I am just putting it out there as I am not in a position to move forward in the art world... not yet...

Due to the nature of the commercial art industry, everything is going digital... and I need to follow along or I'll be left in the dust.  

The more work an artist does the more their drawing/ painting hand and wrist are exhausted and over-stressed.  Using the tool I need, there is smoother, less stressful strain on your hand and wrist.  This will help me in my journey as an illustrator to provide for my family.   I am not in a position that will allow me to acquire the appropriate tools I need for my hand's stress and my career's progression.

How Your Contributions Help

My campaign is a simple one.  I need funding to purchase a drawing tablet so I can continue working and push my art forward.  There are screens called Cintiqs, which are computer monitors that you can draw directly on.... they are expensive ($2,000.00 - $2,500.00) amazing pieces of technology that one day I may be able to afford.  But I am realistic  and don't need much, only a chance... and my campaign would allow me to get a less expensive Yiynova MSP19U Tablet Monitor ($599.00+tax+shipping).  It works similarly to the Cintiq  and is more affordable. 

It is the solution that will help me get my illustration production to the next level and continue to do what I love as I help my wife to provide for my family while protecting my hand and wrist from further stress and pain.
With this monitor, I will be able to create for my kids and survive in the commercial art industry.

Growing up in Brooklyn, New York everyone I knew thought I would become "rich and famous" for my art.... but that hasn't happened.  I am almost making a living at it but surviving due to my wife's career as a NYC public school teacher. It's not a pity parade, its just an unfortunate fact, like many can attest to.  I was told by an illustrator buddy of mine about Indiegogo.... so I thought it couldn't hurt to try.

If You Can't Contribute

I understand if you can't contribute....  Heck, I am asking for contributions for an art tool... so I get it.   I just appreciate you reading my story and spending time here with me. 

 You can still help by sharing my campaign with people who may want to be involved and contribute.

You can use Indiegogo share tools to post my campaign on social networking sites...!

If that is too much, any advice to how I can get to my goal would be great too! 

Even just a positive word is a step in the right direction for me...! 

I sincerely was concerned that people in the illustration field who are friends of mine (and associates), plus other friends who don't draw for a living were going to think I was pan-handling... but with tears in my eyes I'll tell you, sometimes just scraping up the money for something that will turn the tide seems impossible.  So thank you.... thank you so much for not judging me.

I really appreciate you reading this much and hearing my story.  I am so very grateful for your time and understanding.... I wish you a life of health, happiness, love and laughter!   Because everyone deserves to find happiness...! Find your bliss and make it your life....  This is not a dress rehearsal....

Thank you all so very much for your time and understanding. It means more than you know!

:)

AND - Thank you so much to those who have contributed... we have reached our goal; and I am beyond honored and humbled by your generosity!!!!!

THANK YOU-THANK YOU-THANK YOU!!!!!!

Some have told me to keep going to get the better tablet... that's not up to me... It's up to those who want to contribute...

I still can't believe it...!!!! Thank you so so soooo much!!!!!

Sincerely,

Gene DeCicco

story:
Come check us out and see how far we've come in four years!

www.armaturenine.com

 

Hello everyone!

Thank you all for helping me get this product off the ground. A9 is the first ever art manikin for professional artists, sculptors and animators.

Over 800 armatures were pre-ordered and shipped through this campaign and every single one was fulfilled and shipped. 

Production to Shipping

story:
My name is Robert Roberg. I am an English professor at the University of Florida and I am a 3-D Fluorescent Artist.

My team and I would like to create America’s first fluorescent 3-D art museum. I have been doing fluorescent black light art for many years and about ten years ago discovered Chroma Depth glasses, and by following their web tutorials, have been able to transform my  art into 3-D black light paintings. We are looking for space  to convert into a not-for Profit museum in The Village of the Arts  in the "Bradenton Florida .

The village of the Arts is "Florida's largest Art colony". The Village contains over 35  art studios. Our goal is to purchase a house, or building, and turn it into a museum.

We need your help. In order to purchase and prepare the museum we estimate we will need $160,000.00. This will include remodeling a space, lighting, fees for legally incorporating locally, statewide and federally.  Within the first year we plan to apply for non-profit status. The non-profit will own the house and the museum will be administered by a board. We will offer classes in many genres of art with a special emphasis on children.

I have two paintings in the Smithsonian Museum of Art and one of my paintings appeared on the front page of the New York Times. I say this to show that I am a serious and recognized artist. 

Please contribute to this once in a life time project. You will be enriching the community, educating children and preserving a unique art form.

What You Get

If you read the list of perks you will see you can sketches, prints and original paintings. Also you will get a feeling of contentment to know you have made the community a better place.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people right now can’t contribute any money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our museum.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Your caring may be the very thing that gets us over the top.

Peace and Love

Robert :)
story_txt:
My name is Robert Roberg. I am an English professor at the University of Florida and I am a 3-D Fluorescent Artist.
My team and I would like to create America’s first fluorescent 3-D art museum. I have been doing fluorescent black light art for many years and about ten years ago discovered Chroma Depth glasses, and by following their web tutorials, have been able to transform my  art into 3-D black light paintings. We are looking for space  to convert into a not-for Profit museum in The Village of the Arts  in the "Bradenton Florida .
The village of the Arts is "Florida's largest Art colony". The Village contains over 35  art studios. Our goal is to purchase a house, or building, and turn it into a museum.
We need your help. In order to purchase and prepare the museum we estimate we will need $160,000.00. This will include remodeling a space, lighting, fees for legally incorporating locally, statewide and federally.  Within the first year we plan to apply for non-profit status. The non-profit will own the house and the museum will be administered by a board. We will offer classes in many genres of art with a special emphasis on children.
I have two paintings in the Smithsonian Museum of Art and one of my paintings appeared on the front page of the New York Times. I say this to show that I am a serious and recognized artist. 
Please contribute to this once in a life time project. You will be enriching the community, educating children and preserving a unique art form.


What You Get
If you read the list of perks you will see you can sketches, prints and original paintings. Also you will get a feeling of contentment to know you have made the community a better place.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people right now can’t contribute any money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about our museum.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
Your caring may be the very thing that gets us over the top.


Peace and Love
Robert :)

story:
“The Oracle of Initiation’s images are haunting, spellbinding, intoxicating, instinctual.  Although seemingly personal, they touch both the ancient and universal in each of us.  Highly recommended as a spiritual companion and tool for your own journey."
Mary K. Greer, author of 21 Ways to Read a Tarot Card

"Mellissae Lucia's amazing Oracle of Initiation is one of a tiny handful of decks I keep in my bedroom, for late night inspiration."
Rachel Pollack, creator of The Shinning Tribe Tarot


About The Oracle of Initiation 
The Oracle of Initiation deck by Mellissae Lucia offers experienced guidance in claiming the beauty in spiritual transformation. The Oracle’s ancient cross-cultural guardians light the way to our rainbows in the dark, the paradox of our greatest gifts hidden within our shadows. Learn to confidently navigate your own initiations with the Oracle’s earthened wisdom, shape-shifting your challenges into your own wild, sovereign brilliance.

The Oracle deck’s Painted Body series emerged directly from artist Mellissae Lucia’s seven-year vision quest after the death of her husband. All of the images in The Painted Body series were taken alone and nude by the artist herself, in the ancient desert landscape of arroyos, canyons, caves, and graffiti tunnels surrounding Santa Fe, New Mexico. In her work, the camera is held at arm's length, making it a literal extension of her body. None of the images in The Painted Body series are altered or retouched in any way.


Making This Happen
I am eight years into this amazing project, and I have been selling Deluxe, limited edition sets of the Oracle deck with the full-size, 400-page book for the last four years. The first edition of 88 decks sold out in 2012, and the second limited edition of 112 is currently available. With print-on-demand costs being high for this Deluxe edition, the $155 price point is an investment. The deck has an underground, cult following, and getting the price point down to $50 will make the deck more accessible for those who are called to it. 

I am asking for your support to fund a little over half of the project, at $8,888. The entire project will come in at about $15,000 for the printing of 1,000* decks, shipping, reward fulfillment, technology and design support, copy editing, and fees to both Indiegogo and the payment methods in the campaign. I have self-funded all my previous projects, and it has always been my dream to see the deck in more hands, and I need your help to make this one happen. I will create the New Edition no matter what, it may be a smaller run and a smaller size, so you will get a deck if you make a pledge, but to print the full run of 1,000 I need to reach my goal, or better. 


*Update as of 6-17-14. There have been 43 new Tarot-sized editions ordered, and I am going to print a smaller run, at a smaller size, not the edition of 1,000. Your wonderful, affordable Oracle deck will come in a lovely velvet bag, with a downloadable PDF as the text. The text will be a little more robust than it would have been in the booklet, with full-color images of the cards. Each $44 Tarot-sized pledger will also get a *special* and *fun* little gift for rolling with the shifts. And honestly, I will put this out there again, the big, deluxe book is really the best option for full-oracle-engagement, so if you wish to upgrade the extra $33 for US orders (international orders add $67 for the deluxe book and shipping) I lovlingly suggest it. This change also means you should get the deck a little sooner. SWEEET! Thanks to everyone who is supporting this amazing project, and keep sharing it to reach the goal and cover the expenses already invested in the project. Only 4 days left!

 

Rewards- Breakin’ It Down
NOTE:  You may choose multiple perks, simply add up the costs, pledge that amount, and say what combination of goodies you will receive in the comments section.



♥ $11  WORDSWAG DIVINATION 

OK, I know, the title is already dated, but I couldn't get it out of my head after using the WordSwag app that places text over your own photos, so go with it. You will receive either on your Facebook page timeline* or in an email a reading from one of the images in The Oracle of Initiation deck with a divinatory message WordSwagged onto it that is your unique oracular guidance for that day. Everyone who contributes gets this perk. 


*Please make sure we are friends on Facebook if you want it on your timeline, and if we are not, please friend me at Mellissae Lucia, as I am blocked from friending you. See my Anatomy of a Crowdfunding Campaign series blog post, “Facebook is Not My God.”


☛ $22  WILD BEAUTY BOOK

Pdf download
Wild Beauty: Divining with The Oracle of Initiation from People Who Love It. 
Fifteen deck devotees share spreads, journeys, photos and unique experiences to broaden our knowledge of how to work with the Oracle in this 105 page PDF, bringing more ritualistic magic and joy into our lives. Many of these processes may also be used with any divinatory system. Everyone who contributes at this level or higher shall get this perk. (coming soon!!!)




☛ $33  MYSTERY COOLNESS + ORIGINAL ART

(both US & Int’l Shipping)

Who knows what you could end up with here. You shall receive a one-of-a-kind, signed “faux-photocopy” 5x7” Painted Body print that was a “beautiful mistake” in my printer. See the images here as an example (you will get one of the 2 chosen intuitively for you). Along with the original art, your Mystery Coolness may be Vintage 1982 MTV and punk rock buttons or a power-filled saint statue; some fly-girl bamboo earrings used in a Painted Body shoot or a Sub Pop Tad & Pussy Galore 45 record; a cool ass 1980s Diabolik comic from Italy or a divination deck from my private collection or a Happy Days or Evel Knievel lunch box filled with sacred bones and feathers found on the land. Give me your shoe and shirt size please. This is SO FUN!


☆ $44  NEW TAROT-SIZED EDITION 
The New Edition Oracle of Initiation set (International shipping add $22) 

Be the first to own the New Edition set which will have heavy-weight Tarot-sized cards,  just right to shuffle and fit into your excited, quivering hands. The deck is full-color, will come in a lovely velvet bag, and comes with a downloadable PDF for the text. This is an $11 savings off of the regular price with shipping after this campaign! International orders please add $22 shipping for a total pledge of $66. Thank you. 


☆ $77  NEW TAROT-SIZED EDITION with DELUXE BOOK 
New Edition deck set with the full-sized, 400-page book (Int’l add $34)

It is highly recommended to add the in-depth, 400-page book that accompanies the Deluxe set to the New Tarot-sized set. A few of the cards in the New Edition will have different images than in the book, but the numbering and guardians remain consistent. This book offers the fullest and richest experience of the deck, including the complete guardian channelings. International orders please add $34 shipping for a total pledge of $111. Thank you.




☛ $88  PAINTED BODY PRINT
One 8x10 Painted Body Print (Both US & Int’l shipping included)
These archival pigments prints are rich, highly saturated reproductions on high-quality, fine-art watercolor paper. Choose one of 15 different Painted Body images in the 8x10” open-edition size. The print will come in a clear wrapper, with a black mat, presentation ready. See the Oracle website store for your choices, and add your choice in your reward comment. www.OracleofInitiation.com/store




♥ $99  READING WITH MELLISSAE

Experience the Oracle’s wisdom firsthand through a 55-minute Soul Path Reading with the deck’s creator over the phone or Skype.




♕ $144  DELUXE DECK & BOOK 
Only 77 available-Instant Gratification Oracle Deluxe set (Int’l add $22) 

It will take about four months for delivery on the new Tarot-sized edition, and if you CANNOT WAIT to get your hands on these cards,  you may have instant gratification by choosing one of the Deluxe, limited edition, signed and numbered Oracle sets, with the big, 4x6” full-color cards and the in-depth, 400-page book. Two new Limited edition cards will be added to the set for this campaign: #65 Mystery, and #88 Rainbow Oracle. Card #88 will only be offered with Deluxe decks purchased during this campaign. (Previous Oracle decks owners may receive card #65 if you donate to the campaign at any level). And as if it couldn't get any better, this is an $11 saving off the retail price! International orders please add $22 shipping for a total of pledge of $166. 


☛ $222  LIMITED EDTION 7X7 BOOKS 
Only 10 of each book available! (choose one) 


For this level I will have two different 7x7” full-color, hardbound books in limited edition quantities of 10 only for each book, in special versions just for the campaign. They will be signed and numbered, and I will print only as many as people have pledged for. The two 7x7” book choices will be the new Painted Body Pairs, with images directly from the deck juxtaposed with another picture from that same shoot as a fascinating view into the mysterious process, and my original Psychedelic Farmlands book called The Other Side of the Mountains. US and international shipping included.


☛ $555  LIMITED EDITION 12X12 BOOKS 
Only 10 of each book available! (choose the one you want) 

The preview copies I ordered for this campaign were the first time I had printed the huge, lush, full-color, hardbound 12x12” books, and I am in love with them. These books are like getting an entire set of limited edition prints all in one place, so great! These will also only be in editions of 10 for each book, signed and numbered, and I will only publish as many as were chosen during the campaign, so they may be even rarer. The first book is my Psychedelic Farmlands series taken on the land in Eastern Washington and Oregon. It will be a little different than the 7x7” The Other Side of the Mountains book.  The second book has been my dream for some time, to have an archive of some of the 40,000+ images in the Painted Body ritualistic photography series that is the artwork in the Oracle deck. This book will not be done until later this summer because I am going to add the stories of some of the shoots throughout the book, with many never-seen images from the series. US and International shipping included.  


✈ $1,111  PLAYDATE WITH MELLISSAE 
Only 11 of these extravaganzas available!

You come and meet me wherever I currently happen to be, and we can have a rockin’ good time anywhere, making art and having fun. Who knows what mischief and mayhem we may co-create during our joyful one-day romp. We might go thrift store shopping (but NO poppin’ tags!). We will sing Kool & the Gang, Stooges, and Fleetwood Mac songs passionately in the car, with our photo booth pictures strewn about the back seat (contingent on a booth’s availability-and it needs to be an old-school booth, with actual photo strips!). 

We may trespass, make stickers to tag with, and shamelessly enjoy selfies. There could be a Spike Lee, David Lynch, or John Hughes movie marathon, and we could leave subversive postcards we make in racks at tourists shops. There are always hidden saints to find, and graffiti filled quonset huts to explore. Elk, beaver, coyotes, and porcupines may cross our path, and we will spend an inordinate amount of time honing our competition-level spit-balls skills (I have giant straws!!!). 

Altars will be be built, and we could bury or burn Oracle cards, collaging with their remnants. We may consider dancing to Kid 'n Play (we ain’t gonna hurt nobody, we just dancin' y’all) and going to see women's roller derby. Good food shall be ingested, and we may need a nap after all of this delight to make it into the evening.

This is an extremely rigorous schedule of fun, so make sure you have been cross-training to keep up. I am a vagabond, so the location and scheduling will need to be determined by where I am. Playdates could potentially be in Istanbul, Thorp, Joshua Tree, Abiquiu, Oakland, Topanga Canyon, Nelson, Prague, Havana, Ocean Side, NYC, Seattle, Bozeman, Tokyo, Palm Desert, Milano, Barcelona, Ketchum, Rio de Janeiro, Mattawa, Oaxaca, Portlandia, Marrakech, Saltspring Island, or some other cool spot. All airfare, travel and accommodations are your responsibility, and I will treat us to yummy food along the way!

Some of the marvy stuff you shall receive (US & Int’l shipping included)

  • Either deck format you desire
  • One 8x10” Painted Body archival pigment print from a choice of 15
  • A carefully curated pile of mystery gifts (give me your shirt and shoe size)
  • And of course some of the unforgettable art, images, and priceless experiences we co-create from this incredible day together. You will have stories for years! 


♥ $5,555  SPIRITUAL INITIATION COUNSELING  
Only 2 available!  

Meet your own wild beauty with the totally personalized Spiritual Initiation Counseling process over the phone or Skype.You shall receive 44 hours of one-on-one, completely individualized guidance from the Oracle and me, focusing on your unique initiatory process, reframing old stories, and opening to your own sovereign brilliance. My own profound awakening after the death of my husband and the creation of the deck have given me great insights and tools to support others in finding their own rainbows in the dark, the brilliance hidden in your shadows. If you are ready to show up and do the work to meet your own fierce, liberated potential, this process offers you experienced guidance to claim the life of your dreams. 


Physical coolness that shall enter your world beyond our 44 hours together (both US & International shipping included) 

  • Either deck format you desire
  • Two 8”x10” Painted Body archival pigment prints from a choice of 15 
  • Surprise gifts to support the emergence of your fabulousness  
  • One of the very rare, Earthen Body books from the edition of 50 

✈$8,888  PAINTED BODY RITUALISTIC QUEST
Only 3 available!

Are you ready to amaze yourself? There are times in our lives when we need a primal experience to usher us into our next stage of development. Powerful rites of passage help us to recognize and embody the person we are becoming. We will design the experience of your dreams, doing ritualistic art, divination, and sacred adventuring on the land. I am offering my services as a guardian and guide for a full-day immersion process on the land where you may meet yourself. All airfare, accommodations and other costs of getting to our rendezvous are up to you, and I shall take wonderful care of you during our magical day together. 


Painted Body Quest Testimonials 

“The sensations of being painted – coolness of the paint, texture of the brushes – made me acutely aware of my skin, and before I knew it, moved me beyond it. While my skin was being covered I slowly became more and more naked to myself. Parts I had never experienced began to surface. These unexperienced parts of me intrigued, and even thrilled me. I slipped into my animal self – and sight, sound, smell, touch, and even taste became attuned and merged. My Western thinking mind no longer had control of me. I was free of ideas of who I was suppose to be. As the sun moved beyond the canyon and shadows fell, my new experiences merged within my more familiar self, now changed forever – now changed for the better. I vibrate differently. I am more assured of my path, and feel the courage to walk it pumping through me.”
Coleen Renee, Ellensburg, WA 

Read more about Coleen Renee’s Painted Body experience: 

Link to article on Mellissae's blog

“My Painted Body Initiation with Mellissae was a truly beautiful experience on all levels, physically (Oh! The land!!), emotionally, spiritually, and energetically beautiful.  The process for me was about leaving old patterns, and taking a courageous leap into an unknown new-self.  I was so honored to have Mellissae hold such a sacred, yet fun space for me. My experience was as much play and joy as it was serious ceremony. Mellissae honored, yet calmed my fears, encouraged me, and fed me yummy food once we arrived back at the car, tired and covered in mud. The insights are still coming four months later, and this was definitely a turning point for me in my process of personal growth and spiritual understanding about my sacred work” 
Amy F. Milder, Santa Fe, NM

Read more about Amy’s Golden Beetle Initiation: 
Link to article on Mellissae's blog

Goodies Galore (both US & international shipping included) 
YOU are a phenomenal Oracle deck supporter, so you shall be showered with gifts, experiences and magical joy! 

  • Both formats of the Oracle deck
  • Surprise mystery gifts of great preciousness from my private collection 
  • One of the very rare, Earthen Body books from the edition of 50 
  • One 15x20” limited edition Painted Body archival pigment prints of your choice from the deck
  • Copies of the photos (if you do that) from your process

Co-create this once-in-a-lifetime experience with me, tailored specifically to meet your own wild independence. This is something that you will touch back into throughout your life to remind you of your raw courage and creative potentials. 


♥ Other Ways YOU Can Help

We are building tribes through the grassroots power of crowdfunding, and passing on information about work you love is so essential. Even if you are not called to donate, please spread the word about this project to people who may be inspired by the Oracle’s magic.



  • Post this campaign on your own Facebook timeline and pages, as well as in your favorite groups. You may also tag your friends in your posts, and directly message them to make sure they get it
  • Tweet the campaign #OracleofInitiation #Oracle Deck #Tarot-sized #indiegogo
  • Write Blog posts about the Oracle’s unique gifts
  • Email 5-10 people personally with whom you wish to share this with 
  • Tell people one-on-one about how the project speaks to you 
  • Send the Oracle love to find its way into the hearts and hands of the people it can best support in these fierce and transformative times  

On the Oracle website and Mellissae Lucia Blog is a place called “Ambassador Crowdfunding Resources” that has pre-written quotes, posts, tweets, and images you can copy and paste easily to be a really brilliant deck devotee. The deck was made in the spirit of collaboration, and it is time for the larger tribe to catapult it into its next phase. Thank you SO MUCH, we cannot do this without you.  


♥ Artemis Return-gifting the deck to girls

I believe deeply in the Oracle’s ability to guide anyone through initiatory transformations, and its unique mysteries speak powerfully to the fierceness of young women's journeys. Part of my own process of claiming my sovereignty during creating the deck was what I call my Artemis Return. Artemis is the virginal Greek huntress goddess who embodies the wild instinctive freedom of the feminine on the land. As a virgin goddess, she is a guardian and guide for young women finding their own authentic power. I have a stash of Deluxe promotional decks from the first printing that I would love to gift to young women. As each $1,111 pledge amount is reached in the campaign, I will send out an update asking your help in finding the young women under 18 who you believe could be powerfully supported by working with the deck. It will be an intuitive lotto as your suggestions flow in, the decks telling me which young women to choose. I believe the personal is political, and the only way we are really going to change the world is one sovereign soul at a time.

Photo Credits
All photos by Mellissae Lucia except the following:
- "Wild Beauty" cover photo by Meekah Sage
- "Reading with Mellissae" photo by Roberta Steele
- "Playdate with Mellissae" photo #1 by Leela Weiss
- "Playdate with Mellissae" photo #2 by MK Barr
